0.title: Makers believe I can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii': Nushrratt
0.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has stated that filmmakers believe she can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii' and 'Ajeeb Daastaans'. "There are some producers who have said, 'We can only think of you,' which is great. It has a lot to do with the body of work," the actress added. She further said that she was offered three women-led movies after 'Chhorii'.

1.title: I'm in favour of a strong opposition in country: PM Modi
1.article_body: Addressing an event at President Ram Nath Kovind's ancestral Paraunkh village in UP, PM Narendra Modi said that he is in favour of a strong opposition. Dynastic politics is throttling talent in the country, he added. Dynastic politics must stop so that anyone born in a village can become the PM and the President, he further said.

2.title: Govt approves 8.1% interest rate on EPF deposits for FY22, lowest in 4 decades
2.article_body: The central government has approved an interest rate of 8.1% on employee provident fund (EPF) deposits for 2021-22, news agency PTI reported citing an office order from the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). In March, the EPFO had lowered the rate to 8.1% from 8.5% in the previous year, marking the lowest EPF interest rate in more than 40 years.

3.title: It was a nightmare to face Wasim Akram: Jayawardena
3.article_body: On being asked the toughest bowler he has ever faced, ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said, "Hands down, Wasim Akram." He added. "I made my debut when he [Akram] was at his peak or...backend of his career...was a nightmare to face him as it was tough." Jayawardena made his international debut for Sri Lanka in 1997.

4.title: PMC to spend ₹170 crore for expansion of 24x7 water supply project
4.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that expansion of the 24x7 water supply project would cost around ₹170 crore. The project will have water supply infrastructure for 34 villages merged into the city civic limits. In the first phase of the project, work will be done in Bavdhan, Sus and Mhalunge.

5.title: Moosewala killed for revenge, I had no role in murder: Lawrence Bishnoi to police
5.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, while being interrogated by the Delhi Police, denied a role in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, reports said on Friday. Bishnoi, however, told police that Moosewala was killed for revenge, reports added. Bishnoi and his aide Goldy Brar are among the prime suspects in the killing of Moosewala who was shot dead on Sunday (May 29).

6.title: Woman in US gets 3D-printed ear made from her cells in world-first transplant
6.article_body: A 20-year-old woman in US, who was born with a small and misshapen right ear, successfully received a 3D-printed ear implant made from her own cells. This is believed to be the first known example of a 3D-printed implant made of living tissues. The new ear will continue to regenerate cartilage tissue, giving it the appearance of a natural ear.

7.title: Bengaluru-based startup joins NASA's PACE mission
7.article_body: Bengaluru-based environment intelligence startup Ambee said that it will join NASA's PACE (Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem) mission. The mission aims to extend and improve satellite observations of global ocean biology, aerosols and clouds. "This collaboration with NASA and PACE scientists will allow us to develop in-depth solutions," Madhusudhan Anand, CTO and Co-founder of Ambee, said.

8.title: Visually-impaired woman seeking help to cross road in Delhi raped
8.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old visually-impaired woman near Sitapuri bus stand in Delhi's Dwarka. "When she asked locals to help her in crossing a road, the accused took her to a deserted lane and raped her," Dwarka DCP Shankar Choudhary said. Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal also met the survivor.

9.title: So proud: Ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama to Gauff on reaching 1st Slam final
9.article_body: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama took to Twitter to congratulate Coco Gauff after the 18-year-old American reached her maiden Grand Slam final at French Open on Thursday. "I'm so proud of you and I will be rooting for you all the way!" she wrote. The 18th seed defeated unseeded Martina Trevisan of Italy 6-3, 6-1 in the semi-final.

10.title: Stone-pelting in UP over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet, 17 held
10.article_body: Two groups clashed in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday over a call to shut down markets following recent controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. At least 17 persons have been detained following the incident, which also involved stone-pelting. As per reports, police used tear gas shells and resorted to lathicharge to bring the situation under control.

11.title: Pre-monsoon works completed in Mumbai, ready for rain: BMC
11.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it is fully prepared for the upcoming monsoon and said all pre-monsoon works including desilting of stormwater drains and trimming of trees have been completed in Mumbai. BMC also added that the situation would be reviewed periodically. This year, two additional NDRF teams will be deployed in areas which are prone to landslides.

12.title: Akshay wanted to reclaim history with 'Samrat Prithviraj': Director
12.article_body: 'Samrat Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that actor Akshay Kumar wanted to "reclaim our history" with the film. He added, "Akshay spoke to me and said, 'I'm ready to do the film...The current narrative of history is such where a section of people in India don't feel proud. Can we reclaim our history?' Soon, everything fell into place."

13.title: Centre writes to 5 states over rise in COVID-19 cases, issues advisory
13.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Health Secretaries of five states that have reported a rise in COVID-19 cases recently. He advised governments of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Telangana, Maharashtra and Karnataka to "maintain strict watch and take pre-emptive action" to control COVID-19 spread. The states have been told to ensure adequate testing, send samples for genome sequencing etc.

14.title: Jaffer shares Salman's meme to troll Lord's pitch after 17 wickets fall in 1 day
14.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled Lord's pitch and took a dig at people who criticise Indian pitches, after 17 wickets fell on Day 1 of England-New Zealand Test. "When 17 wickets fall in a day at Lord's...talk is about skills of...bowlers. When 17 wickets fall in a day at Ahmedabad...talk is about conditions," Jaffer wrote, sharing a Salman Khan meme.

15.title: Rachakonda Police arrest drug peddler, drugs worth ₹30 lakh seized
15.article_body: The Rachakonda Special Operations Team along with the Meerpet Police busted an interstate drug syndicate and seized drugs worth ₹30.29 lakh. Police said that they arrested Parasmal alias Paras Seervi and seized 1 kg of opium, 5.2 kg of poppy straw, 2 kg of poppy straw powder and other materials. Another suspect named Deepak is absconding, the police said.

16.title: Mumbai taxi drivers unfairly targeted over minor offences: Union
16.article_body: General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union AL Quadros criticised Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey and alleged that taxi drivers were 'unfairly targeted over minor traffic offences'. He further claimed that the police made matters worse for drivers by registering offences for honking. Drivers whose daily income is less than ₹300 cannot afford to pay such fines, Quadros added.

17.title: GHMC Mayor launches phase 4 of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' in Hyd
17.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said the fourth phase of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' was launched at NBT Nagar Banjara Hills division. This programme focuses on urban sanitation by desilting all drains, solid waste management and removal of construction and demolition debris, Gadwal added. The programme will be conducted from June 3 to June 15.

18.title: Nearly 60 kg expired meat seized during raid at Chennai restaurant
18.article_body: Tamil Nadu Food Safety Department officials have found nearly 60 kilograms of expired meat, including chicken and fish, after raiding a restaurant on Chennai's 100 Feet Road. The raid was conducted following a customer's complaint. Officials said the meat was stored in a damaged freezer box and the restaurant has been asked to shut down its kitchen for 15 days.

19.title: Happy 13 years to me & my dear 'Pavitra Rishta': Ankita Lokhande
19.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande shared pictures on social media to celebrate 13 years in the television industry and her show 'Pavitra Rishta'. "[Thank you] everyone for making this day so memorable. I loved each and every edit u guys have made...I love each and every one and so grateful for all the love [you] give," the actress wrote.

20.title: Police arrest girl & 2 friends for trying to snatch chain in B'luru
20.article_body: A girl student and two of her friends were arrested in Bengaluru for attempting to snatch a gold chain from an elderly woman, the police said. The girl had approached the elderly woman on the pretext of giving her a pamphlet. The police also said that the accused had tried to steal the chain to repay a loan of ₹5,000.

21.title: Amit Shah holds high-level security meeting over killings in J&K
21.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday held a high-level security meeting over the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. The meeting was attended by National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Army Chief General Manoj Pande, among others. At least three civilians and two security personnel were killed in the Union Territory last month.

22.title: Europe believes its problems are world's problems, world's issues aren't Europe's: EAM
22.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar while speaking at a GLOBESEC discussion, said, "Europe has to get out of the mindset that Europe's problems are the world's problems but the world's problems are not Europe's problems." He said this in response to a question comparing the India-China conflict with the Russia-Ukraine war and India's stance on the Ukraine war.

23.title: We should save Kashmiri Pandits: Kangana on violence in J&K
23.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday took to Instagram Stories to react to the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir which were claimed by Lashkar-e-Taiba terror group's outfit The Resistance Front. Sharing a screenshot of a news article, she wrote, "We should save Kashmiri Pandits." Reportedly, nine people have been victims of targetted killings in the union territory since May 1.

24.title: People left hanging upside down as ride gets stuck at amusement park in US
24.article_body: Visitors at an amusement park in Pennsylvania, US were left hanging upside down on a ride after it malfunctioned and stopped mid-air. The incident took place on Monday at the Kennywood amusement park where the Aero 360 ride got stuck at the top. The riders were evacuated and officials said no one was hurt.

25.title: Who are India's top 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani tops the list?
25.article_body: Mukesh Ambani on Friday became India's richest person with a net worth of $99.7 billion, as per Bloomberg. He's followed by Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion), Azim Premji ($28.7 billion), and Shiv Nadar ($25.9 billion). The list of India's 10 richest people includes Lakshmi Niwas Mittal ($20.1 billion), Radhakishan Damani ($19.6 billion), Uday Kotak ($14.8 billion) and Dilip Sanghvi ($14.5 billion).

26.title: I'd call Hardik the junior version of Dhoni: GT spinner Sai Kishore
26.article_body: GT spinner Sai Kishore, who was with CSK before IPL 2022 season, said that GT skipper Hardik Pandya is the "junior version" of MS Dhoni, adding there are a lot of similarities between the two. "Much like Dhoni, Hardik has the knack of getting the best out of his players. Both put the team before themselves," he added.

27.title: Man arrested for beating 2 ragpickers to death in Pune
27.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly beating two unidentified ragpickers to death in Pune's Saswad area. The accused, identified as Nilesh alias Pappu Jaywant Jagtap, is a food cart owner and a resident of Tathewadi village in Saswad. Notably, the two deceased were aged between 50-60 years old, police said. Meanwhile, the accused also assaulted a 65-year-old female ragpicker.

28.title: I hope I do as good as Priyanka Chopra, Lara Dutta: Manushi Chhillar
28.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, in a recent interview, credited the Miss World platform for being noticed by Yash Raj Films (YRF). "I give a lot of credit to that platform, but it comes with the fact that people...have preconceived notions and certain expectations," she added. The actress stated that she hopes to do "as well as Priyanka Chopra or Lara Dutta did."

29.title: 87 women workers fall sick after gas leak at Andhra chemical plant
29.article_body: At least 87 women fell sick after a gas leak was reported at the laboratory of a chemical plant in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday. According to Anakapalle SP, all workers' health is currently stable and no casualties have been reported. Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy inquired about the gas leak and said that the incident should be investigated.

30.title: Never imagined I would be directing you: Atlee on working with SRK
30.article_body: Director Atlee on Friday penned a note on collaborating with actor Shah Rukh Khan for his upcoming film 'Jawan'. "Feeling emotional, excited and blessed. Grew up admiring you but never imagined that I would be directing you, sir," Atlee tweeted while sharing the film's teaser. Produced by Red Chillies Entertainment, 'Jawan' will release on June 2, 2023.

31.title: NATO should consider de facto membership for Ukraine: Defence Min
31.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Friday said that NATO should consider granting Ukraine "de facto" rather than "de jure" membership of the alliance. "It could be the good idea in this strategy," he added. Notably, NATO will discuss its strategy for the next 10 years at a summit in Spain's Madrid in June.

32.title: Doesn't matter what happens: 18-yr-old Coco Gauff on French Open final
32.article_body: American tennis player Coco Gauff, who is 18 years old, said the result of her upcoming French Open 2022 women's singles final against world number one Iga Swiatek "doesn't matter" to her. "There [are] so many things going [on] in the world...It's not important to stress over a tennis match," added Gauff. "My parents...[will] love me regardless," stated Gauff.

33.title: Politics should not be done: Delhi CM Kejriwal on Moosewala's murder
33.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that politics shouldn't be done over Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "Punjab Chief Minister [Bhagwant Mann] has said all efforts are on and he has assured that the culprits will be caught and punished," Kejriwal said. The AAP-led government faced criticism after Moosewala was killed just a day after it downgraded his security.

34.title: Russia-Ukraine war will have no winner, UN says on 100th day of fight
34.article_body: The ongoing Russia-Ukraine war "will have no winner", the UN said on Friday, as the fighting entered its 100th day. "This war has taken an unacceptable toll on people and engulfed virtually all aspects of civilian life...We've witnessed destruction and devastation across cities, towns and villages. Schools, hospitals and shelters haven't been spared," UN Assistant Secretary-General Amin Awad said.

35.title: Hopefully we can bring some joy to Sri Lanka: Finch ahead of SL tour
35.article_body: Ahead of Australia's tour to Sri Lanka, limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that "hopefully" the team can bring "some joy" to crisis-hit Sri Lanka. "We are here to play cricket. Hopefully, we can bring some joy and entertainment to Sri Lanka...This is the first time we're here since 2016, which is such a long gap," Finch said.

36.title: Today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was: Narayana Murthy
36.article_body: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy while speaking at an event organised for startups, said, "I personally think that today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was." He added that there are three ingredients for success as an entrepreneur, namely, access to customer or market access, access to talent, and availability of venture capital funds.

37.title: SRK, Kajol's on-screen son Jibraan to return to films with Ishq Vishk sequel
37.article_body: Jibraan Khan, who portrayed Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol's son in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', is returning to films with 'Ishq Vishk Rebound', a sequel to Shahid Kapoor and Amrita Rao-starrer film 'Ishq Vishk'. Sharing a poster of the film on his Instagram handle, he wrote, "Dreams do come true." It will also star Hrithik Roshan's cousin Pashmina Roshan.

38.title: Roadies' Varun Sood joins Johar's talent management company DCA
38.article_body: Actor Varun Sood, known for participating in 'MTV Roadies', has joined Karan Johar's talent management company Dharma Cornerstone Agency (DCA). The official Instagram handle of DCA made the announcement on Friday, writing, "From Roadies to #JugJuggJeeyo, make way for digital sensation Varun Sood as he embarks on his acting journey!" Varun also appeared in the show 'Ragini MMS Returns'.

39.title: IIT grads-led startup Yojak lays off 60 full-time employees: Report
39.article_body: Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal and Info Edge-backed e-commerce platform Yojak has laid off more than 60 full-time employees over the last two months, media reports said. It has also laid off around 75-80 contractual workers. Founded by IIT Roorkee graduates Anuj Jain and Rachit Garg, Yojak is a B2B online marketplace of building materials.

40.title: Vote bank politics: Govt on US report alleging attacks on minorities in India
40.article_body: The government on Friday responded to a US State Department report, released by Secretary of State Antony Blinken, alleging that minority communities in India faced attacks in 2021. Calling Blinken's remarks "ill-informed", it said, "It's unfortunate that vote bank politics is being practised in international relations. We would urge that assessments based on...biased views be avoided."

41.title: Tata Projects to build Noida International Airport in UP's Jewar
41.article_body: Tata Group's infrastructure and construction arm, Tata Projects, has been selected to undertake the engineering, procurement and construction of the upcoming Noida International Airport in Uttar Pradesh's Jewar. "Tata Projects will work closely with Yamuna International Airport Private Limited (YIAPL) to deliver India's most advanced and environment-friendly airport on time," CEO Vinayak Pai said.

42.title: Success didn't change him: World no. 1 Swiatek on Nadal
42.article_body: Praising Rafael Nadal, world number one Iga Swiatek said success hasn't changed the 21-time Grand Slam champion and "he's still the same great person". She added, "He's that kind of a guy that's always saying 'hi'." She further said that Nadal inspires her in every aspect. Meanwhile, Swiatek will face 18th seed Coco Gauff in French Open final on Saturday.

43.title: 13-yr-old raped by cousin in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
43.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her cousin in Punjab's Hoshiarpur district. According to the police, the incident, which happened on the intervening night of May 30 and 31, took place on the roof of her house. Notably, the victim's parents had gone to Rajasthan to her grandfather's house when the incident took place, police said.

44.title: Man kills 2 women & then himself at church in US' Iowa
44.article_body: A man shot and killed two women before taking his own life in the parking lot of a church in US' Iowa on Thursday. Police believe it was an "isolated incident". Separately, multiple gunshots were fired into a crowd of mourners attending a graveside funeral in Wisconsin, wounding two people. No arrests have been made in connection to Wisconsin's shooting.

45.title: Even if Virat Kohli scores a 50, people say he has failed: Azharuddin
45.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said people say Virat Kohli has failed to perform even if he scores a half-century. "There is nothing wrong with his technique. Sometimes you also need a little bit of luck," added Azharuddin. "If he gets one big score...the aggression and...confidence will come back," stated Azharuddin. Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022 for RCB.

46.title: No improvement in Kashmir despite abrogation of Article 370: Sanjay Raut
46.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the recent killing of a bank manager, identified as Vijay Kumar, by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam. "You (BJP) talked about the return of Kashmiri Pandits and fetched votes in the name of Hindutva. There is no improvement in people's lives despite the abrogation of Article 370," Raut said.

47.title: Heroin worth ₹20 lakh seized in Assam; 2 arrested
47.article_body: Two drug peddlers were arrested after heroin worth ₹20 lakh was reportedly seized in the Kaliganj area of Assam, the officials said on Friday. "We have apprehended two persons named Nur Hussain and Monirul Islam and we recovered four soap cases containing 43 grams of suspected heroin," the Additional Superintendent of Police, Partha Pratim Das said.

48.title: Chinese banks agreed to refinance $2.3 bn in debt to Pak: Minister
48.article_body: Chinese banks have agreed to provide 15 billion renminbi (about $2.3 billion) in refinancing to Pakistan, Pakistani Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said. "Inflow is expected shortly after some routine approvals...This will help shore up our foreign exchange reserves," he added. Notably, Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves have declined to just over $9.7 billion, according to official data.

49.title: Brad Pitt-starrer 'Bullet Train' to release in India on August 5
49.article_body: Actor Brad Pitt's upcoming film 'Bullet Train' will release in theatres in India on August 5. In a statement on Wednesday, Sony Pictures India announced that the action comedy film will be released in four languages including English, Hindi, Tamil and Telugu. Directed by David Leitch, 'Bullet Train' is based on the Japanese novel 'Maria Beetle' by Kotaro Isaka.

50.title: Kenyan man who attacked 8 in Mumbai has mental health issues: Police
50.article_body: The 50-year-old Kenyan national who attacked eight pedestrians with a knife near Bombay High Court on Wednesday has mental health issues, police said on Friday. During interrogation, the accused changed his versions and also spoke about God, a police official said. While he was arrested on the same day, the injured people were admitted to a hospital, he added.

51.title: India gets Asia's largest Liquid Mirror Telescope, pic released
51.article_body: India has set up its first Liquid Mirror Telescope (LMT) in Uttarakhand to observe supernovae, space debris, asteroids and other celestial objects, the government said. The telescope is Asia's largest and has been built by astronomers from India, Belgium and Canada. It is located at an altitude of 2,450 metres at the Devasthal Observatory in Nainital.

52.title: Remove fliers from planes if they violate COVID-19 norms: Delhi HC
52.article_body: The Delhi High Court has called for strict action against those found violating mask and hand hygiene protocols at airports and in aircraft, while observing that the COVID-19 pandemic hasn't abated. "Violators should be removed physically, if need be," it added. The bench also observed that violators should be booked, fined and placed on the no-fly list to ensure compliance.

53.title: Hemsworth's 'Thor: Love and Thunder' to release in India a day before US
53.article_body: Marvel India on Friday announced that 'Thor: Love and Thunder' will release in India on July 7, one day before the US market. The Taika Waititi directorial stars Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Karen Gillan, Chris Pratt and Russell Crowe among others in pivotal roles. 'Thor: Love and Thunder' will feature Christian Bale as the supervillain, Gorr the God Butcher.

54.title: Chhattisgarh CM requests PM to refund ₹17,240 cr collected under NPS
54.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has requested PM Narendra Modi to direct the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) to refund ₹17,240 crore deposited towards the National Pension System (NPS) since November 2004. This comes after PFRDA rejected the state government's request to withdraw the money. Baghel said that his government has decided to reinstate the old pension scheme.

55.title: Pak’s bowling attack is world's best, English players praise us: Rizwan
55.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan said Pakistan's bowling attack is the best in the world. "It feels really great when...some English players praise our bowlers," added Rizwan. Talking about Pakistan captain Babar Azam, Rizwan cited the example of him threatening to walk out of a Pepsi advertisement when asked to consume the beverage during Ramadan, as an indication of his greatness.

56.title: What Bhangra is for Punjabis, films are for Telugu audience: Adivi
56.article_body: Speaking about why the pandemic didn't impact Telugu film industry, actor-filmmaker Adivi Sesh said, "What Bhangra is for Punjabis, films are for the Telugu audience." He further said the industry had a "bonanza of films" doing well between the first and second COVID-19 waves. "The confidence of taking Telugu cinema into Hindi and the world comes from...support of...audience," Adivi added.

57.title: Over 30,000 Russian soldiers killed: Ukraine as war enters 100th day
57.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that it has killed around 30,950 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said that its forces have destroyed 1,367 Russian tanks and over 380 aircraft, including 175 helicopters. The ministry added that 3,366 armoured personnel carriers, 675 artillery systems and 207 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

58.title: Sony to help satellites in orbit communicate via space lasers
58.article_body: Sony has formed a new unit, Sony Space Communications, that will build and supply devices to help small satellites in orbit to communicate with one another via laser beams. The devices will work between satellites in space and satellites communicating with ground stations. Sony did not specify when it expects to have its first commercial device operating in space.

59.title: SC bans mining, factories within 1 km of national parks, sanctuaries
59.article_body: There can be no mining and factories in a one-kilometre buffer zone around wildlife sanctuaries and national parks, Supreme Court said. If existing Eco-Sensitive Zone goes beyond buffer zone or if any statutory instrument prescribes a higher limit, then such extension shall prevail, SC added. Manufacturing and similar activities underway along these zones will go on only with official permission.

60.title: SC dismisses plea over illegal excavation, construction at Puri temple
60.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea alleging illegal excavation and construction work by the Odisha government at the Shree Jagannath Temple in Puri. The construction activity being undertaken is necessary for the larger public interest, it added. The court said that a PIL other than being in the public interest is detrimental to the public interest, SC stated.

61.title: Up to 40 people trapped as fire breaks out in 10-storey building in Russia, pics surface
61.article_body: As many as 40 people are feared to be trapped after a huge fire broke out in a 10-storey office building in Moscow. Several people have been seen on the roof of the Grand Setun Plaza building in Kuntsevo district, nine miles from the Kremlin. A team of around 200 firefighters is at the scene attempting to save lives.

62.title: Struggle is 'glamourised unnecessarily' in industry: Panchayat's Pankaj Jha
62.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Pankaj Jha said actors should learn from their struggling days and not dramatise it into a "sob story". "One should even enjoy the struggle," Jha added. He further stated that poverty and struggle are "glamourised unnecessarily" in the industry which is "rubbish". "What is wrong [with] doing the job of a peon?" the actor further asked.

63.title: Amitabh shares throwback pic from wedding on 49th anniversary
63.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to Instagram on Friday to share a throwback picture with Jaya Bachchan from their wedding on the occasion of their 49th wedding anniversary. "I fold my hands and thank all those who have showered love to Jaya and me on our marriage anniversary. Thank you," he wrote. Several people congratulated Amitabh and Jaya in the comments section.

64.title: KK was a real artiste, he never cared about networking: Farah Khan
64.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan condoled singer KK's demise saying he was a real artiste who only cared about singing. She added, "He wasn't networking [or] trying to get...second song from you. He would come quietly and do his job." Farah further said that the last time she met him, he told her, "Make a film quickly so that I can sing."

65.title: Shah Rukh Khan's look with bandaged face from new film 'Jawan' goes viral
65.article_body: The teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Jawan' was released on Friday, showing the actor's new look for the film, directed by Atlee. Shah Rukh's face can be seen wrapped in bandages in the teaser. The film is set to release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada on June 2, 2023.

66.title: 1,800 pilgrims from Telangana to travel to Mecca as Haj resumes
66.article_body: As many as 1,800 Hajis from Telangana will travel to Mecca as the Haj pilgrimage resumes in July 2022. "We, along with the government of Telangana, have visited the airport twice to see...no problems are being faced," said Haj Committee Chairman Mohammed Saleem. "If any traveller has COVID-19, he'll have to be dropped from the list," he added.

67.title: We're investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh: Billionaire Gautam Adani
67.article_body: Billionaire industrialist Gautam Adani on Friday said that the Adani Group is investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh. Adani further said that ₹24,000 crore will be invested in developing UP's road and transport infrastructure while another ₹35,000 crore will be invested in the state's multimodal logistics and defence sectors. "We anticipate this investment creating over 30,000 jobs," said Adani.

68.title: Man can't save dharma: Prakash on 'Aashram 3 defames Hinduism' claim
68.article_body: Director Prakash Jha reacted to claims of web series 'Aashram 3' defaming Hinduism, saying, "Admi dharma ko nahi bacha sakta, dharma admi ko bachata hai (Man can't save dharma, dharma saves man)." He further said that the show is a work of fiction, adding that whatever is true is religion and if something is untrue then it can't be religion.

69.title: 2 kids drown while bathing in a pond in UP's Jhansi
69.article_body: Two kids, aged nine and 11, drowned in a pond while bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi district. The bodies of the deceased were recovered with the help of divers on Thursday evening, SHO of Gursarai police station Arun Kumar Tiwari said. Notably, they were declared dead by the doctors at the community health centre, Gursarai.

70.title: 85% complaints on BESCOM WhatsApp helpline resolved: Officials
70.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has resolved 628 of the 736 complaints it had received within a week, which is about 85%, through its WhatsApp helpline numbers, according to officials. The consumers have been sending pictures and videos of the power-related issues, which helps officers resolve the problem on a priority basis, a BESCOM official said.

71.title: Investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore signed in Uttar Pradesh: PM Modi
71.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday, addressing Uttar Pradesh Investors Summit, said investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore have been signed across sectors in the state, which will help create thousands of employment opportunities. "I congratulate the youth of UP...as they'll benefit most from this," he added. "This is the time to set new goals for next 25 years," the PM said.

72.title: Kartik not running after money: 'Bhool...' producer on fee hike report
72.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' producer Bhushan Kumar said in an interview that Kartik Aaryan "isn't running after money". This comes after a report claimed that Kartik has hiked his fee after Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success. Bhushan, who has collaborated with Kartik for another film, said the film went through a difficult phase in terms of finances, but Kartik stood by them.

73.title: Cristiano? They often ask why he is a starter: Portugal coach Santos
73.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo, Portugal football team's coach Fernando Santos said, "Cristiano Ronaldo? They often ask why he is a starter. It's the million-dollar question." Santos did not include Cristiano as a part of the starting XI for Portugal's UEFA Nations League match against Spain which ended 1-1. He termed this decision as a "technical" and "tactical" move.

74.title: I'd like to play there: Bavuma on competing in IPL in future
74.article_body: South Africa limited-overs captain Temba Bavuma has expressed his desire to play in the IPL, saying, "The stronger my performances, the more realistic the opportunity becomes." He added, "I've also developed this fantasy of captaining a team." The 32-year-old was not one of the 33 South African players who entered the IPL 2022 mega auction in February.

75.title: Tesla calling staff for 40 hrs/week is like the 1950s: Aus billionaire
75.article_body: Australian billionaire Scott Farquhar commented on Tesla's return to office directive saying it feels "like something out of the 1950s". As per the directive, employees at Tesla are required to spend a minimum of 40 hours in the office per week. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to Farquhar's tweets saying they "illustrate why recessions serve a vital economic cleansing function".

76.title: Hardik Pandya is a 4D player now: Kiran More after GT's IPL win
76.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More has said that Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya is "a four-dimensional player now". "Earlier he was a three-dimensional player...but now he is captain as well," More said. "He used to keep running behind the nets and catching the ball (at More's cricket academy)...that's when I saw the hunger in his eyes," he added.

77.title: Russia, China not interested in working with us on N Korea: US
77.article_body: China and Russia are clearly not interested in working with the US to manage North Korea's nuclear and missile arsenal, US' nuclear envoy Sung Kim said on Friday. His comments came after Russia and China last month vetoed a UN resolution sponsored by the US to impose more sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches.

78.title: Elon wanted to be the wealthiest man even as a pre-schooler: Musk's father
78.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol Musk told AFP that even as a pre-schooler, the Tesla CEO had set his sights on becoming the wealthiest man alive. Recalling an incident when Elon announced his plans to become a millionaire, Errol said an adult told him that he would be disappointed. "Elon responded, 'Well, I think you're stupid'. That's typically Elon," said Errol.

79.title: No plans to attack Russia with US rockets: Ukraine
79.article_body: Ukraine is "waging a defensive war" and doesn't plan to use multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS) it receives from the US to attack facilities in Russia, a Ukrainian presidential advisor said. "Our partners know where their weapons are used," Mykhailo Podolyak added. Earlier, Russia had said it doesn't trust Kyiv to not use the weapons to fire into Russian territory.

80.title: 9 PMC junior engineers fined ₹10,000 each for dereliction of duty
80.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to fine nine of its junior engineers ₹10,000 each for dereliction of duty during projects carried out by contractors, officials said on Thursday. An audit by a third party, which was examined by a committee, found that the nine junior engineers hadn't followed the norms while clearing contractors' bills, according to an official.

81.title: Delhi woman says co-passenger flashed her at Jor Bagh metro station
81.article_body: A woman has claimed that she was flashed by a co-passenger at Delhi's Jor Bagh metro station. According to her, the man committed the crime on the pretext of asking her help with an address. She alleged that she ran to a nearby policeman, who refused to help and asked her to go to other officers to talk about it.

82.title: I have miles to go: Kartik on 'saving' industry with 'Bhool...'
82.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, on being told he saved the Hindi film industry with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said he is flattered and humbled by the statement, adding he has miles to go and lots more to do. He added, "Stardom for me...has only meant love from my fans...When the love grows, I only feel more...motivated...as it is to them...I owe my success."

83.title: I haven't made easy choices: Varun Dhawan on 'Jugjugg...', 'Bhediya'
83.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, while talking about his upcoming projects 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' and 'Bhediya', said he hasn't made any "easy choices". "I'm not playing the smart alec, with a 100 one-liners and body-hugging clothes," he said while referring to his character in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. The actor added that he has inferred a lot from his personal life for the film.

84.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani becomes 8th richest?
84.article_body: Elon Musk is the richest person worldwide with a net worth of $227 billion on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index. He's followed by Jeff Bezos($149 billion), Bernard Arnault ($138 billion), Bill Gates ($124 billion), Warren Buffett ($114 billion), Larry Page ($106 billion), Sergey Brin ($102 billion), Mukesh Ambani ($99.7 billion), Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion) and Steve Ballmer ($96.8 billion).

85.title: Google to merge Meet and Duo into a single video calling app
85.article_body: Google has announced that it will merge its video-calling apps Meet and Duo into a single app in the coming weeks. Duo app will be renamed to Google Meet, the company said. It'll add features to Duo such as the ability to schedule meetings, customisable virtual backgrounds in calls and meetings, and allow up to 100 participants in video calls.

86.title: Indian govt team makes 1st official visit to Afghanistan since 2021 Taliban takeover
86.article_body: An Indian delegation led by a Foreign Ministry official met the Taliban regime in Afghanistan's Kabul on Thursday. This is the first official Indian visit to Kabul since the Taliban took over Afghanistan in August 2021. As per the Ministry of External Affairs, the purpose of the visit was to discuss India's humanitarian aid to Afghanistan.

87.title: Urfi shares screenshots of abusive messages, says 'The way people want me dead is scary'
87.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT contestant Urfi Javed took to Instagram Stories to share screenshots of hate and abusive messages she received. One of the trolls said Urfi should've been dead instead of Sidhu Moosewala. "I am no where involved in anyone's death (RIP to the departed souls) but the way people want me dead is so scary," Urfi wrote.

88.title: Gippy asks music labels to not leak Moosewala's upcoming songs, threatens legal action
88.article_body: Punjabi singer and actor Gippy Grewal has requested music producers to refrain from releasing Sidhu Moosewala's upcoming tracks without the consent of the singer's father. He also said that they will take legal action against those who leak Sidhu's songs. "Please hand over all the content to his father after Sidhu's Bhog on June 8," Gippy added.

89.title: Fire breaks out in godown in UP's Ghaziabad, no casualties reported
89.article_body: A fire broke out in a godown near Shaheed Nagar Metro Station in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Friday, officials said. "More than 12 fire tenders are engaged in dousing operation. No casualties have been reported. Fire has been brought under control," Chief Fire Officer (CFO) said. "It will take some more time to douse the fire completely," the CFO added.

90.title: 24-yr-old man wanted in murder case held in east Delhi
90.article_body: A 24-year-old man wanted in a murder case was arrested by the police in the east Delhi area on Friday. The accused, identified as Prince Wadhwa, was allegedly involved in the murder of a man, identified as Jitender Chaudhary, at Krishna Nagar on May 24. Notably, Wadhwa allegedly committed the crime along with two of his associates, police said.

91.title: Watching KK perform live was a learning experience: Shilpa Rao
91.article_body: Singer Shilpa Rao, while talking about late singer KK, said bond with a fellow musician is inseparable because their music lives on forever. "I was fortunate that I had the opportunity of opening his concerts and watching him perform live was always a learning experience for me," Shilpa said. She further called KK one of the most supportive persons.

92.title: Nehra is one of the best tactical coaches in IPL: Kirsten
92.article_body: Gujarat Titans mentor Gary Kirsten has said that the franchise's coach Ashish Nehra is "tactically one of the best coaches in the IPL". "He (Nehra) coaches with his heart, always thinking about his players and how he can help them," Kirsten said. He added, "Ashish wants his players to have options and he helps them understand when to use them."

93.title: Hardik had only 1 lifeline, that was to do well in IPL 2022: Sodhi
93.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said all-rounder Hardik Pandya was far away from knocking on the doors of the Indian team before IPL 2022 and struggling in his career. "He had only one lifeline and that was to do well in IPL 2022," added Sodhi. "If a guy's life has been changed by IPL 2022, it is Hardik," stated Sodhi.

94.title: WB man prints fake notes, gets beaten up when paid with those; arrested
94.article_body: Police arrested a 59-year-old man for allegedly printing fake currency notes in West Bengal's Bankura. The accused, Gurupada Acharjee, reportedly used a ₹500 note to buy toys at a shop. When the shopkeeper realised it was fake, he was beaten up by the locals. Police have recovered fake notes of value ₹1,65,560, a printer and other materials from his home.

95.title: Prithviraj, Sanyogita also had an age difference: Manushi on age gap with Akshay
95.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, speaking about the 29-year age gap between her and 'Samrat Prithviraj' co-star Akshay Kumar, said, "Our characters (Prithviraj and Sanyogita) also had an age difference." "Irrespective of who's older than whom, it doesn't matter if...woman or man is older, cast should be appropriate," she said, adding, "You're a good actor...if you're able to look (close to your character)."

96.title: Police chief didn't know of 911 calls: Senator on Texas school shooting
96.article_body: The commander overseeing police during a shooting at an elementary school in Texas wasn't informed of panicked 911 calls coming from children trapped inside, Senator Roland Gutierrez said. "There's human error, there's system error," Gutierrez added, saying it was unclear exactly who was receiving the calls. Twenty-one people, including 19 kids, were killed in the mass shooting on May 24.

97.title: Mukesh Ambani replaces Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man
97.article_body: Reliance Industries's Mukesh Ambani has replaced Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man. According to  Bloomberg Billionaires Index, as of June 3, the total net worth of Mukesh Ambani is $99.7 billion and the total net worth of Gautam Adani is $98.7 billion. While Ambani now stands at the eighth position worldwide, Adani is placed in the ninth place.

98.title: Maha man on ventilator dies due to power outage at home: Police
98.article_body: A 38-year-old man, who was put on ventilator support at his home in Maharashtra's Kolhapur, allegedly died after the breathing machine stopped functioning following a power outage. The patient was suffering from a lung illness for the past few years, police said. The electricity distribution company had snapped the power supply alleging non-payment of bill, police added.

99.title: Couldn't muster courage to talk to KK's wife or kids at funeral: Javed Ali
99.article_body: Singer Javed Ali expressed grief over the demise of KK, saying, "I cannot focus and concentrate on anything. I just can't forget KK." He said he "couldn't muster the courage" to speak with KK's wife and children at the funeral, which was held on Thursday in Mumbai. "I shall go to meet KK's...family after a few days," Javed further said.

100.title: Russia achieved none of its initial objectives in Ukraine: UK
100.article_body: As the war in Ukraine entered its 100th day, UK Defence Ministry said Russia has failed to achieve its initial objectives to seize Kyiv and Ukrainian centres of government because of "false planning and poor tactical execution". The ministry added that the war in Ukraine will continue for some time if the Kremlin wants to achieve any form of success.

101.title: Moosewala's body acted as shield, saved his friend from fatal injuries: AAP MLA Banawali
101.article_body: AAP MLA Gurpreet Banawali, after meeting with Sidhu Moosewala's injured friends, said Moosewala went down fighting. "After suffering multiple bullet injuries, Moosewala fell on (his friend) Gurpreet. Moosewala’s body acted as a shield and probably saved Gurpreet from fatal injuries," he said. "Moosewala fought and fired back despite being attacked from three sides," Banawali added.

102.title: Motor mechanic held for raping, impregnating 17-yr-old girl in Gurugram
102.article_body: A 21-year-old motor mechanic was arrested for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl and impregnating her in Gurugram, police said. A complaint was lodged by the girl's mother on Wednesday alleging that a man repeatedly raped her daughter. "She told me that a man who came to our tea stall was raping her on the pretext of marriage," the mother said.

103.title: South Korea to remove quarantine for unvaccinated foreign arrivals
103.article_body: South Korean PM Han Duck-soo on Friday said the country will lift its seven-day quarantine requirement for foreign arrivals without vaccination from June 8, adding that the COVID-19 situation in South Korea has stabilised. He further said that South Korea will also start lifting aviation regulations imposed on international flights to ensure that they can operate in a timely manner.

104.title: Tesla needs to cut staff by 10%: Elon Musk as he pauses all hiring
104.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the company needs to cut staff by around 10% as he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy, according to an internal email. The email, titled "pause all hiring worldwide", was sent to Tesla executives on Thursday. Earlier, Musk asked Tesla employees to return to the office or leave the company.

105.title: Edtech startup Udayy shuts down, fires entire staff of 100-120 employees
105.article_body: Gurugram-based edtech startup Udayy has shut its operations and fired its entire workforce of 100-120 employees after business slowed due to the resumption of offline classes in schools. Udayy Co-founder Mahak Garg in a LinkedIn post said that all employees were paid a generous severance and the decision was announced in a company-wide town hall on April 4.

106.title: After parents scold him over video games, 18-year-old boy kills self in TN
106.article_body: An 18-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after getting upset over his parents scolding him for playing video games in Vellottamparappu in Tamil Nadu's Erode, police said. The deceased reportedly consumed poison when his parents went to work on Wednesday. On being informed of the matter, the parents took their son to a hospital where he was declared brought dead.

107.title: Take strict action against Kashmir killings: BSP chief Mayawati to Centre
107.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Friday urged the Centre to take strict action against the recent targeted killings in Kashmir. "Innocent people are being killed every day in Jammu and Kashmir...there's an atmosphere of panic," Mayawati tweeted. "The central government should take strict action against such guilty elements, this is the demand of BSP," she added.

108.title: African Swine Fever detected at Manipur farm; owner claims 80 pigs culled
108.article_body: African Swine Fever outbreak was confirmed at a piggery in Manipur's Kamjong on Thursday, following which Deputy Commissioner declared the 1 km radius around the farm as an "infected zone". The piggery's owner claimed that 80 pigs have been culled in the last few days. The Deputy Commissioner also declared the 10 km radius around the farm a "surveillance zone".

109.title: Had Sardar Patel not acted, India's map wouldn't be the same: Shah
109.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said India would have had a different map if Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel had not taken police action. "Entire country is indebted to Sardar Patel for liberating us from the tyrannical rule of the Nizams," Shah said at an event to celebrate Telangana Formation Day. He further accused Telangana CM KCR of not cooperating with Centre.

110.title: 2 dead, 30 hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in MP
110.article_body: Two people died and around 30 others are hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur, the district hospital in-charge said. "A health team has been deployed," the district hospital in-charge added. A slurry of rainwater and cow dung somehow entered a pit, which had a valve of a pipeline deep in the ground, District Collector Rohit Singh said.

111.title: SBI assures financial support to family of bank manager killed in J&K
111.article_body: SBI on Thursday assured financial support to the family of the 26-year-old bank manager who was shot dead by terrorists inside Ellaquai Dehati Bank in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. EDB is a Srinagar-headquartered regional rural bank sponsored by SBI. Kumar was one of many such bankers working in Kashmir Valley ensuring uninterrupted banking services to the public, SBI added.

112.title: Moosewala also opened fire, unfortunately he had just 2 bullets left: AAP MLA Banawali
112.article_body: After meeting the two injured friends of Sidhu Moosewala, AAP MLA Banawali said the accused punctured the singer's vehicle's tyres and opened fire from three sides. "Moosewala also opened fire, but unfortunately he had just two bullets left in his weapon," he added. "According to his friends, he had exhausted them all a few days ago," Banawali said.

113.title: Rohit understands us well, comes up with Plan B if we struggle: Siraj
113.article_body: Team India pacer Mohammed Siraj said it is a great feeling to play under Team India captain Rohit Sharma who understands the players so well. "Whenever we have a tough time out there on the field, he is the one who comes up with a plan B and motivates the bowlers to do better in the game," added Siraj.

114.title: Truck driver runs over 3 drunk men in Chennai, arrested
114.article_body: A truck driver from Uttar Pradesh was arrested for allegedly running over three drunk men at a private truck yard in Chennai. Police said, the men, who were consuming alcohol in the yard, got into an argument with the driver, harassed and demanded money from him, following which he attempted to flee. He didn't intentionally run over them, police added.

115.title: Woman sexually assaulted at Delhi's Jor Bagh Metro Station
115.article_body: A woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by a fellow passenger at the Jor Bagh Metro Station in New Delhi. The woman alleged that the accused did inappropriate behaviour while asking for help with an address. In a series of tweets, the woman alleged that she didn't receive much help from the police officials at the station.

116.title: Umran made people run away by threatening them: Aakash Chopra on IPL 2022
116.article_body: Discussing SRH pacer Umran Malik's performances in IPL 2022, former India opener Aakash Chopra said, "He has made people run away by scaring and threatening them." "Whenever he has bowled well, he has taken three-four wickets and even a five-wicket haul," added Aakash. "He is the Jammu Tawi Express," stated Aakash. Umran picked 22 wickets in IPL 2022.

117.title: 2 children drown while taking bath in river in UP's Pilibhit
117.article_body: Two children drowned while taking a bath in the Sharda river in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit. The body of deceased, identified as Mohini (12) and her cousin Aniket (14), were recovered with the help of locals. According to the police, locals told that Mohini started drowning first while taking bath and Aniket also drowned in trying to save Mohini.

118.title: 7 feared charred to death as bus catches fire after collision with tempo in K'taka
118.article_body: As many as seven people travelling in a private bus are feared to have been charred to death in an accident near Kamalapura in Karnataka's Kalaburagi on Friday, police said. The accident took place when the bus, carrying 29 passengers from Goa to Hyderabad, and a tempo collided, police added. The other 22 passengers managed to escape from the bus.

119.title: Ahmedabad man held for circulating child pornography on social media
119.article_body: Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell on Thursday arrested Deepak Shankhalpara, a resident of Jashoda Nagar, for allegedly storing and circulating child pornography material on social media. "Upon checking...cellphone of the accused, we've found 13 videos of child porn," a police officer said. "Apart from this, the accused had also shared child pornography material on Facebook Messenger," the officer added.

120.title: Canada accuses China of harassing its aircraft near North Korea
120.article_body: The Canadian military has accused Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft during UN sanctions patrols along the border with North Korea to monitor evasions. Canadian Armed Forces said on several occasions its aircrews have had to alter their path to "avoid a potential collision with the intercepting aircraft". The incidents occurred between April 26 and May 26, it added.

121.title: Actor Adivi Sesh gets honorary medal from Black Cat Commandos for 'Major'
121.article_body: Adivi Sesh's 'Major' was recently screened for National Security Guard (NSG) in Mumbai, where 312 commandos watched the movie with their families. The actor received an honorary medal from the Black Cat Commandos for his performance in the film. 'Major' is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

122.title: Samrat Prithviraj is a very important film in my career: Akshay Kumar
122.article_body: Akshay Kumar has called his film 'Samrat Prithviraj' a rare project, adding that it's a very important film in his career. "It's my legacy project because I'm getting to honour...legendary Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan," he added. Akshay further said he hopes this film inspires many to lead their life with strong values and "get the courage to stand up against...every evil".

123.title: 17-yr-old girl returning home after party gang-raped in Hyderabad
123.article_body: A 17-year-old girl returning home after attending a get-together at a pub was gang-raped in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills area. According to police, some of the youngsters who'd met the victim at the party approached her, offering to drop her home. "When...car stopped at an isolated location in...darkness, the youngsters violated her one after the other," a police officer said.

124.title: Instagram expands Reels to 90 seconds, allows users to add own audio
124.article_body: Meta on Thursday announced a series of updates and new features for its Reels on Facebook and Instagram. While Instagram Reels' length has been extended to 90 seconds from 60 seconds, users can now also import their own audio directly. Instagram Reels will now also have the option of adding stickers, poll, quiz and emoji slider stickers.

125.title: Scoring 50s, 60s won't help Vihari; important to get tons: Azharuddin
125.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said India batter Hanuma Vihari can play for the national team for a long time, only if he scores big runs consistently. "It's very important for him to get the big scores. He has to score hundreds to grab the chance," added Azharuddin. "Scoring only 50s and 60s is not...going to help him," stated Azharuddin.

126.title: Russia shipped 1 lakh tonnes of stolen wheat to Syria: Ukraine
126.article_body: Russia has sent its ally Syria an estimated 1,00,000 tonnes of wheat stolen from Ukraine since invading the country on February 24, the Ukrainian embassy in Beirut said in a statement to Reuters. "This is criminal activity," it added. The embassy alleged that the wheat was "stolen from a facility that combines wheat from three Ukrainian regions into one batch".

127.title: Women climb down 30-ft well to get water in MP; videos surface
127.article_body: Videos of women climbing up a 30-foot-deep well in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Dindori after going down to get drinking water has surfaced online. "Be it day or night, we've to go down the well and fetch water...politicians come but nobody solves our problem," a villager told The Quint. "We'll not cast...votes now until we get...water," another villager claimed.

128.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami wins Champawat bypolls, to remain Uttarakhand CM
128.article_body: BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami on Friday won the Champawat bypolls by over 55,000 votes and he will now continue to remain the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand. He defeated Congress' Nirmala Gahotri, SP candidate Manoj Kumar and independent candidate Himanshu Garkoti. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Dhami and said, "I'm confident he will work even harder for the progress of Uttarakhand."

129.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' banned in Kuwait, Oman: Reports
129.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', which released in India today, has been banned in Kuwait and Oman, as per reports. In a tweet shared by trade analyst Girish Johar, it was mentioned that the governments of the two countries have banned the film on the warrior king. Meanwhile, Qatar has reportedly put the release of the film on hold.

130.title: Gold price rises slightly today, silver selling at ₹62,700 per kg
130.article_body: Both gold and silver futures have climbed in the domestic market on June 3 after trading on the lower side for three days in a row. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold futures stand at ₹51,340/10 grams. The previous close was recorded at ₹51,269. Meanwhile, silver is selling at ₹62,700 per kg.

131.title: CM Mann should apologise to Moosewala’s parents: Warring
131.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann must own moral responsibility for Sidhu Moosewala's death and apologise to his parents. The state government's decision to restore security of those protectees whose security it had withdrawn earlier hints at its negligence and grave lapse, he alleged. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

132.title: Coinbase extends hiring freeze, revokes some accepted job offers
132.article_body: Coinbase has extended its hiring freeze for "as long as the macro-economic factors remain in place". They also revoked accepted offers from some candidates who haven't joined it yet. "We always knew cryptocurrency would be volatile, but that volatility alongside larger economic factors may test the company, and us personally, in new ways," said LJ Brock, Coinbase's Chief People Officer.

133.title: Slandering of people in higher positions on rise: CJI NV Ramana
133.article_body: Chief Justice of India Justice NV Ramana on Thursday said that slandering of people who are in higher positions has been on the rise in recent times. "Those who could not achieve their selfish goals through the system are giving misinterpretation to courts' judgements through which the number of people who get sadistic pleasure is also increasing," Ramana added.

134.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru rise by 75% in a day to 276
134.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by nearly 75% in a day to 276, according to BBMP data for Thursday. The city had reported 158 daily cases on Wednesday. The total active clusters in the city also rose to six in the same period, while the deaths due to the virus remained zero on both days.

135.title: After Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19
135.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Friday tweeted that she has tested positive for COVID-19. This comes a day after party chief Sonia Gandhi contracted the infection. Adding that she has mild symptoms, Priyanka wrote, "Following all the protocols, I have quarantined myself at home. I would request those who came in contact with me to take all necessary precautions.”

136.title: Apple to improve working hours for retail staff in the US: Report
136.article_body: Apple has agreed to improve the working conditions of its retail staff in the US and make their work schedules flexible, amid employees' push towards unionisation, media reports said. The changes will include extending the minimum time period between shifts to 12 hours from 10 hours. Employees won't be scheduled to work more than five days in a row.

137.title: 3 Indian Navy personnel held for assaulting shop owner, 2 others in Mumbai
137.article_body: Three Indian Navy personnel were arrested on Thursday for allegedly ransacking a pan shop and assaulting three persons, including the shop owner, in south Mumbai. The incident occurred on Wednesday night when the accused were consuming alcohol near a residential area, police said. They were angered after residents requested them to stop drinking which led to an altercation, police added.

138.title: SRK's film with Atlee titled 'Jawan', actor to play double role: Report
138.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie with filmmaker Atlee is reportedly titled 'Jawan'. "The announcement will be made soon by releasing a teaser which is about 1 min 34 seconds long," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will reportedly feature Shah Rukh in a double role. Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra are also part of the film.

139.title: Beating Federer with full stadium backing him my best match ever: Cilic
139.article_body: Former US Open champion Marin Cilic said he considers defeating Roger Federer in the semi-finals of the US Open in 2014, as the best match he has ever played. "The crowd that I was faced against...they were cheering obviously for [Federer], full stadium," added Cilic. Cilic defeated Federer 6-3, 6-4, 6-4, going on to win his maiden Grand Slam title.

140.title: Tesla may have Optimus prototype working for AI Day on Sept 30: Musk
140.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm's AI Day has now been pushed to September 30. "Tesla AI Day pushed to September 30, as we may have an Optimus prototype working by then," he wrote on Twitter. Earlier, Musk had confirmed that Tesla would show a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot on its now-delayed AI Day.

141.title: 22-yr-old man held for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow in Pune
141.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow in Pune's Lonavala. The accused was reportedly found in an objectionable position with the cow by one of his neighbours, following which the animal's owner filed a complaint. A case has been filed against the accused under Section 377 of the Indian Penal Code.

142.title: I saw Dr Strange, I was like I want to be part of Marvel universe: Kartik
142.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, on being asked if he has seen a trailer in recent times that made him want to be a part of it, said, "Recently, I saw Dr Strange in...theatre, I was like...I want to be...part of...Marvel universe." "They...know how to create magic," he added. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is the highest-grossing film of the year.

143.title: Man, link between LeT & Pune terror operative Junaid, arrested in J&K
143.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad arrested 28-year-old carpenter, Aftab Hussain Shah, from Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar in connection to case in which Mohammed Junaid was arrested from Pune last month. Shah is believed to be the link between Junaid and a Lashkar-e-Taiba operative based in a foreign country, an officer said. He'll be produced before a local court in Pune on Friday.

144.title: For 1st time in 3 decades, Noida RTO generates highest revenue in state
144.article_body: Since its formation in 1993, the Noida RTO for the first time has generated the highest revenue among all 75 districts of Uttar Pradesh. The Noida RTO earned ₹496 crore in 2021-22. It achieved 89.7% of its revenue target followed by Mirzapur (79.5%) and Lucknow (79.51%). Notably, Noida RTO comes under the Meerut zone which comprises six districts.

145.title: Which words were Spelling Bee's 14-year-old Indian-origin winner Harini asked to spell?
145.article_body: Harini Logan, 14-year-old Indian-origin girl from US' Texas, who won the 2022 Scripps National Spelling Bee, was asked to spell the words tyrolienne, tauromachian, ditalini, charadriiform, sereh, drimys and Powys. Among the 22 words she spelled correctly in the spell-off were spealbone, phreatophyte, gaydiang, parison, glochis, saccharose, chorepiscopus, ornithorhynchus, nandubay and malbrouck.

146.title: Everyone eats same food, uses same restrooms: Musk on Tesla's work culture
146.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while responding to a Twitter user regarding Tesla's work environment, said, "Everyone eats the same food, uses the same restrooms, etc- no executive chef or other ivory tower stuff. There shouldn't be this workers vs management two-class system. Everyone is a worker." The Twitter user had remarked that there is "no blue/white distinction" at Tesla.

147.title: Citizenship Amendment Act will not be implemented in Kerala: CM Vijayan
147.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday said that his government would not implement the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the state. "The government has a clear position on CAA. That will continue," he added. "No one here has the authority to determine citizenship on the basis of religion," Vijayan stated. "Nowadays, attempts are being made to destroy secularism," he added.

148.title: Indian-origin teen Harini Logan wins Spelling Bee 2022; spells 22 words in 90 secs
148.article_body: Harini Logan, 14, an Indian-origin teenager living in San Antonio, Texas, has won the Scripps National Spelling Bee 2022. In a first-of-its-kind spell-off round, Logan spelt 22 words in 90 seconds beating 12-year-old Indian-origin Vikram Raju. Logan's final winning word was 'moorhen', a kind of a water bird. She received a trophy and a cash prize of $50,000.

149.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann meets Sidhu Moosewala's family amid protests by locals
149.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann today met the family of late singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala in Moosa village in Punjab's Mansa district. Mann visited the Moosewala family, four days after the singer-politician was shot dead. Heavy security was deployed near Moosewala's residence and across the village as several locals held protests against the AAP government.

150.title: Testament of faith: Zelenskyy as 50 embassies resume operations in Kyiv
150.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 50 embassies have resumed operations in Kyiv amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. "Every new embassy that returns to our capital is a testament to our faith in our victory," he added. Earlier, India announced that its embassy in Ukraine, which was temporarily operating out of Poland, would resume its operation in Kyiv from May 17.

151.title: 6 college students suspended for wearing hijab in Karnataka
151.article_body: Six students from Karnataka's Government First Grade College, Uppinangady were suspended on Thursday for wearing hijab, according to the institute's authorities. The students, who were suspended for two days, will be provided remedial classes, a college teacher said. The decision was taken to "contain violence and to prevent the issue from escalating," college authorities said.

152.title: UN approves change of Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye'
152.article_body: The UN has changed Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye', following a request from Ankara for it. The rebranding is done in order to dissociate it from the bird of the same name and the negative connotations associated with it. "Türkiye is the best representation and expression of the Turkish people's culture, civilisation, and values," said the Turkish President last year.

153.title: Replicating Cristiano's style of play is 'impossible': Karim Benzema
153.article_body: Real Madrid's Karim Benzema said replicating Cristiano Ronaldo's style of play is impossible, adding that he "dissected" everything from Cristiano. "I tried to concentrate on his movements, dribbling, passing, ball handling," stated Benzema. Cristiano previously played for Real Madrid scoring 451 goals in 438 matches. He also became Real Madrid's all-time record goalscorer.

154.title: Congress misusing power to win Rajya Sabha polls: Vasundhara Raje
154.article_body: BJP leader and former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Thursday accused the Congress government of misusing power to win elections for four Rajya Sabha seats in the state. Her comments came after Congress MLAs were lodged in hotels amid fears of poaching. "A police vehicle has been placed behind every MLA. This is a complete abuse of power," Raje added.

155.title: WB Class 10 board exams results declared; Arnab Ghorai, Raunak Mondal emerge toppers
155.article_body: West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE) on Friday declared the results of the Madhyamik Class 10 exams. WBBSE announced Arnab Ghorai and Raunak Mondal as two toppers for this year with 693 marks. The overall pass percentage this year is 86.60%. Purba Medinipur district has the highest pass percentage at 97.63%, followed by Kalimpong at 94.71%.

156.title: 4,041 new COVID-19 cases, 10 deaths recorded in India in last 24 hours
156.article_body: India recorded 4,041 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths related to the virus in the last 24 hours. Further, India reported 2,363 COVID-19 recoveries, taking the total recoveries to 4,26,22,757. Meanwhile, the total death toll has risen to 5,24,651. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 21,177.

157.title: If SRK wants to be in Ms Marvel, we'll go film again: Co-executive producer
157.article_body: Sana Amanat, co-executive producer for Marvel Studios' series 'Ms Marvel', said in an interview that the team will "film again" if Shah Rukh Khan wants to be in the show. "Shah Rukh, if you want to work with us, we're down for it," she added. In addition to Iman Vellani, the upcoming series will also feature Farhan Akhtar.

158.title: Gold worth over ₹1 crore seized at Hyderabad airport, 2 arrested
158.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad airport arrested a passenger for smuggling gold worth ₹1.65 crore on Thursday. The authorities also apprehended an employee working at the airport's COVID-19 testing centre after finding packets containing gold in the centre's dustbin. According to officials, the passenger had handed over the packets to the employee during sample collection for COVID-19 test.

159.title: UK's Queen Elizabeth to miss Friday's jubilee event amid 'discomfort'
159.article_body: Britain's Queen Elizabeth will miss a National Service of Thanksgiving on Friday after experiencing "some discomfort" during Thursday's Platinum Jubilee celebrations, Buckingham Palace said. The Platinum Jubilee celebrations mark 70 years since the Queen's coronation. On Thursday, the 96-year-old monarch had waved at crowds from the palace balcony as she watched the four-day jubilee events begin.

160.title: Import of Russian crude oil is not an India-related issue at all: MEA
160.article_body: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday spoke about India's approach to Russian oil imports. "We've consistently maintained that our approach is guided by our energy security requirements...Many regions and countries have taken policy decisions recently with a similar perspective...This is not an India-related issue at all." He was answering a query on the increase in Russian oil imports.

161.title: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar tests COVID-19 positive
161.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar has tested positive for COVID-19. "I have tested positive for COVID-19, after being uninfected through three waves of the pandemic," he tweeted on Thursday. "I have moderate symptoms and will home-isolate myself and follow all protocols. Grateful that I am fully vaccinated," Sudhakar added. Notably, Karnataka on Thursday reported 297 new COVID-19 cases.

162.title: Hardik is bowling 4 overs but for how long we don't know: Azharuddin
162.article_body: Talking about India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "He is bowling his four overs...[but for how] long he will bowl we really don't know." "We definitely want him to bowl since he is an all-rounder," added Azharuddin. Hardik picked eight wickets for GT in the recently concluded IPL 2022 and had an economy rate of 7.27.

163.title: JNU student accuses seniors of ragging, administration begins probe
163.article_body: Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) said it has initiated an investigation after a first-year undergraduate student accused two seniors of ragging. One of the accused used to force her to do chores like washing her clothes, utensils, etc, she claimed. "My life on campus has become...intolerable due to...acts of these people," she alleged in a letter to the administration.

164.title: Kuwait summons top US diplomat over tweets 'supporting homosexuality'
164.article_body: Kuwait Foreign Ministry on Thursday summoned the US Embassy's acting Charge d'Affaires over tweets from the American embassy "supporting homosexuality". The embassy had posted a rainbow flag and a message of solidarity from US President Joe Biden for Pride month in both English and Arabic. Kuwait has asked the US embassy to respect Kuwaiti laws and "not publish such tweets".

165.title: Speeding truck hits tractor-trolley in Punjab; 3 dead, 12 injured
165.article_body: Three people were killed and 12 others were injured after a speeding truck collided with their tractor-trolley near Punjab's Tarn Taran on Thursday. A person filed a complaint claiming that the tractor-trolley had overturned on being hit by the truck, following which the latter vehicle's driver had escaped from the scene. The deceased are aged between 20 and 30.

166.title: Elon is a very caring person, he wants to save humanity: Musk's father
166.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview spoke about the former's upbringing and their relationship. Errol said, "Elon is a very caring person. He really means it when he says that he wants to save humanity. This is not a slogan or some sort of pitch." Musk and Errol are reportedly estranged and last met six years ago.

167.title: Fake call centre that cheated man of ₹1.62 cr busted in Noida, 16 held
167.article_body: Noida Police arrested 16 persons for running a fake call centre in Ghaziabad for two years. The accused had allegedly cheated a 61-year-old retired general manager of a public sector undertaking of ₹1.62 crore, among others. The accused cheated people by assuring them they could help recover the money of policies they had only paid one instalment for, police said.

168.title: 3 booked for pelting stones, assaulting 2 men in Gurugram
168.article_body: Three unidentified suspects were booked for assaulting two men, identified as Chirag Singh (31) and Chandrakant Singh (35), in Sector 16, Gurugram. The accused allegedly pelted stones at the duo's car and assaulted them, leading to Chandrakant's jaw getting broken. Notably, the accused "either had plans to rob the victims or fight with them in an inebriated state", police said.

169.title: 10 robots deployed to help people at B'luru airport on pilot basis
169.article_body: Airport authorities have deployed 10 robots, called 'Temi', at Terminal-I of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru on a pilot basis in a bid to help passengers. "Temi, also called Sky, will not only answer passengers' queries but also help them locate various spots at...airport," an official said. The robots will be mapped to a particular floor, airport authorities said.

170.title: Pune police arrest man over threat to Maha Women Commission head
170.article_body: Pune's Sinhagad police have arrested a man for allegedly making a death threat and abusive phone call to Maharashtra State Commission for Women Chairperson Rupali Chakankar. The accused claimed in a video, while under custody, that his rivals were controlling him through satellite. A police officer said that the accused was remanded to magisterial custody for 15 days.

171.title: I learned a lot from Pujara, rate him very highly: Muhammad Rizwan
171.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan said cricketers from India and Pakistan wish to play against each other. "[However]...state-level affairs are not in the control of players," added Rizwan. Talking about Team India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, Rizwan stated that he learned a lot from Pujara when they played together for county cricket club Sussex. "I rate [him] very highly," he said.

172.title: Deadline to set up Marathi signboards extended to June 30 in Mumbai
172.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has extended the deadline for setting up Marathi signboards at all shops in Mumbai to June 30. "We'll carry out...ground-level survey between July 1 and 15 to identify if any shops...have failed to comply with the rules," Municipal Commissioner IS Chahal said. The BMC had earlier set a deadline of May 31 for the same.

173.title: Amber Heard 'absolutely not' able to pay over $10 million to Johnny Depp: Actress' lawyer
173.article_body: On being asked if Amber Heard is able to pay Johnny Depp over $10 million in damages after losing the defamation trial, Amber's lawyer Elaine Charlson Bredehoft said, "Oh no...absolutely not." "She was demonised here. A number of things were allowed in this court that shouldn't have been allowed...and it caused jury to be confused," Elaine said about the judgement.

174.title: Making the squad one thing, entering the playing XI another: Bond on Arjun Tendulkar
