174.article_body: Talking about Arjun Tendulkar not being selected in MI's playing XI in last two seasons, MI bowling coach Shane Bond said, "He's got some work to go." He added, "When you're playing for a team like Mumbai...making the squad is one thing, but entering the playing XI is another." "Arjun needs to work on his batting and fielding," Bond stated.

175.title: Noida Authority demolishes 62 farmhouses along Yamuna floodplains
175.article_body: Noida Authority on Wednesday demolished 62 farmhouses along the Yamuna floodplains as part of the anti-encroachment drive, officials said. As many as 55 farmhouses situated at Tilwada and seven at Gulavali were demolished, officials added. "As per the rules, permanent structures cannot be maintained on floodplains, and any construction is liable to be dismantled," a Noida Authority official said.

176.title: Instagram launches AMBER alerts in 25 countries to help find missing children
176.article_body: Instagram has launched AMBER alerts to help locate missing children. The feature will be rolled out in 25 countries such as Australia, Ukraine, the UK and the US. It said the authorities can turn on the AMBER alert in a designated area and users will receive information like the child's photo, location of abduction and other details on their feed.

177.title: 8 workers injured after blast at chemical factory in Gujarat's Vadodara
177.article_body: At least eight workers were injured following a blast at a chemical factory at Nandesari Gujarat Industrial Development Corporation (GIDC) in Vadodara on Thursday evening. The condition of three injured workers is said to be critical. The fire that broke out following the blast could be seen from the highway, around 10 kilometres away, officials said.

178.title: Amber Heard to appeal against Johnny Depp's defamation trial verdict: Report
178.article_body: Actress Amber Heard is reported to be planning an appeal after losing a defamation trial against her former husband Johnny Depp over allegations of domestic abuse. The court ruled in favour of Depp's claim of defamation on three counts and awarded Depp $15 million in damages. Heard succeeded on only one count and was awarded $2 million.

179.title: Cyber solutions are the need of the hour: Karnataka IT Minister
179.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan called "cyber solutions the need of the hour" and said that it is important for everyone to be cyber-responsible. "Cyber awareness is the key to diving into the ocean of the Internet and swimming without worrying about getting phished," Ashwathnarayan said. His comments came after unveiling the anniversary edition of 'Cyber Vartika'.

180.title: Moosewala died within 15 minutes after being shot, had 19 bullet marks: Autopsy report
180.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's body had 19 bullet injuries and he died within 15 minutes of being shot, according to his autopsy report. The cause of death was "hemorrhagic shock which is due to ante mortem fire arm injuries described and sufficient to cause death in ordinary course of nature," the report said. The maximum injuries were on right side, it said.

181.title: England-NZ Test paused after 23 overs for 23-second applause to pay tribute to Warne
181.article_body: During the first day of the first England-New Zealand Test at Lord's, the match was paused after 23 overs of New Zealand's first innings for a 23-second applause to pay tribute to late Australian spin legend Shane Warne. Fans were urged to stand up and applaud for Warne, whose jersey number was 23.

182.title: Haven't met Rahul Gandhi in 4 years: Congress' Prithviraj Chavan
182.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said he has not been able to meet senior leader Rahul Gandhi in the last four years. "There was no 'chintan' or introspection at the recent Congress conclave," he said. There's a complaint that the party leadership is not as accessible as it should be, he added.

183.title: Terrorists shoot dead migrant labourer hours after bank manager's killing in J&K
183.article_body: Terrorists fired at two migrant labourers working in a brick kiln in J&K's Budgam district, following which one succumbed to his injuries while one is being treated at a hospital, police said. The incident comes hours after a 26-year-old bank manager from Rajasthan named Vijay Kumar was shot dead inside the bank by a terrorist in Kulgam.

184.title: Smugglers posing as police held in MP, drugs worth ₹12 lakh seized
184.article_body: Two marijuana smugglers dressed in police uniform were arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Morena on Thursday. Over 1.25 quintal marijuana worth ₹12 lakh, two mobile phones and a vehicle worth ₹21 lakh were seized from them, reports said. Police acted after receiving information that two smugglers were travelling in an SUV, out of which one person was dressed in police uniform.

185.title: I was a known choreographer, got my due credit because of TV: Geeta
185.article_body: Choreographer and dance reality show judge Geeta Kapur said that television has given her an identity lift and her due credit. "I was already a known choreographer in the industry, but I got a face to the name and recall value, all thanks to TV,” she added. "How you see me behave on TV is my real self," Geeta said.

186.title: Why look for Shivling in every mosque: RSS chief amid Gyanvapi mosque case
186.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi mosque survey case, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said, "We have devotion towards Gyanvapi and doing something as per that, it's alright. But why look for a Shivling in every masjid?" He further stated that people shouldn't bring out a new matter daily, adding, "Why should we escalate the dispute?"

187.title: RTI activist shot dead in broad daylight outside PWD office in MP's Vidisha
187.article_body: A 36-year-old Right to Information (RTI) activist was shot dead by unidentified persons in broad daylight outside the Public Works Department (PWD) office in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha on Thursday. Ranjeet Soni was a small-time PWD contractor and used to file RTIs to get information related to work being done by the department, police said. Soni was shot in the head.

188.title: Sri Lanka seeks to secure $5 billion to cover import repayments
188.article_body: Sri Lanka is seeking to avail around $5 billion in funding to cover repayments of fuel imports and other items bought through credit lines, the Prime Minister's Office said on Thursday. Sri Lanka is seeking another $1 billion to bolster its foreign reserves. The country is also reportedly looking to borrow $3 billion under International Monetary Fund's Extended Fund Facility.

189.title: World no. 1 Iga Swiatek to face 18-yr-old Coco Gauff in French Open women's singles final
189.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek will face 18-year-old Coco Gauff in French Open 2022 women's singles final. Swiatek, 21, defeated world number 20 Daria Kasatkina in the semi-final to reach her second Roland Garros final in three years. Meanwhile, world number 23 Gauff defeated world number 59 Martina Trevisan 6-3, 6-1 to reach her maiden Grand Slam women's singles final.

190.title: 'PM Shri Schools' to be set up to prepare kids for future: Minister
190.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said the Central government has been in the process of establishing "PM Shri schools" in order to prepare students for the future. This will be a laboratory for the National Education Policy, he added. "The next 25 years are crucial to establish India as a knowledge economy that is committed to global welfare," Pradhan said.

191.title: 3 killed, 1 injured in a car-truck collision in MP's Gwalior
191.article_body: Police said that three persons including a woman were killed and another person was injured after their car collided with a truck in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior district. The car rammed into the truck coming from the opposition direction on Agra-Mumbai National Highway, police said. The truck driver escaped from the spot after the accident, they added.

192.title: Targeted killings in J&K a conspiracy by Pakistan: BJP leader
192.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP President Ravinder Raina said the recent targeted killings in the Union Territory is a conspiracy by Pakistan to create fear and sabotage the Centre's efforts to restore peace. Raina claimed that Pakistan wants to create an "Afghanistan-like situation" in the valley. His comments came after a bank manager was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam.

193.title: North Korea takes over as head of UN-backed disarmament body
193.article_body: North Korea has taken over as the rotating head of the UN-backed Conference on Disarmament. The country, which is currently under sanctions for developing nuclear weapons in defiance of UNSC regulations, gained the presidency as the role rotates in an alphabetical manner among its 65 members. North Korea has conducted over 10 ballistic missile tests since January this year.

194.title: Film looks better if watched with a ticket: Akhilesh to CM Yogi
194.article_body: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath watched 'Samrat Prithviraj' with his cabinet at Raj Bhawan, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The film looks even better if viewed...with a ticket instead of free." Akhilesh said it doesn't harm the revenue of the state. "After watching the historical film, the cabinet is requested to also see...present condition of UP," he added.

195.title: Pics shows UK Queen Elizabeth II's platinum jubilee celebration
195.article_body: Pictures of UK Queen Elizabeth II's platinum jubilee celebration at the Buckingham Palace to mark her record-breaking 70 years on the British throne have surfaced online. Thousands of people gathered to attend the first day of the four-day celebration. It included military parade and a fly-past as the Queen and her family stood in the balcony of the palace.

196.title: Domestic violence has no gender: Tina Datta on Johnny Depp-Amber Heard verdict
196.article_body: Actress Tina Datta reacted to Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's verdict. She said, "Domestic violence has no gender and after reading up on the case details, I was totally rooting for Johnny." "He was clearly the one being abused in every way, physically, mentally, financially and even psychologically. But...Johnny didn't sit and sulk in a corner," she added.

197.title: PFI raised funds from China, involved in terror funding, Delhi riots: ED
197.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED), in its chargesheet filed in PMLA court, has stated that the Popular Front of India (PFI) raised funds from China and is involved in terror funding. ED stated that PFI is also involved in illegal activities like anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protests, inciting violence in the Delhi riots and making posters related to Babri Masjid.

198.title: Police constable kills self with AK-47 at Punjab AAP MLA's house
198.article_body: A policeman deployed for the security of Punjab AAP MLA Sheetal Angural shot himself dead with an AK-47 rifle on the premises of the legislator's residence in Jalandhar on Thursday. Pawan Kumar, 29, had joined back work on Thursday after a leave of seven days. The constable had recently been married.

199.title: Haryana Congress MLAs taken to Chhattisgarh resort amid poaching fears
199.article_body: Haryana Congress on Thursday shifted its MLAs to a resort in Naya Raipur, Chhattisgarh amid fears of poaching ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls. Buses carrying the MLAs were seen arriving at the Mayfair resort amid heavy police deployment. Party MP Deepender Singh Hooda had earlier said, "No MLA is upset...All MLAs will go to Chhattisgarh."

200.title: 22-year-old singer Sheil Sagar from Delhi passes away due to unknown causes
200.article_body: Sheil Sagar, a 22-year-old Delhi-based musician and singer died due to unknown causes. The news of his death was confirmed on social media by his friends and musicians in Delhi. According to a Rolling Stones report, Sheil played the piano, guitar and saxophone and rose to prominence with his acoustic debut single 'If I Tried' last year.

201.title: Imran Khan granted pre-arrest bail in Azadi March cases till June 25
201.article_body: A Pakistani court has granted ex-PM Imran Khan pre-arrest bail till June 25 in cases related to violence that erupted during his Azadi March last month. The Peshawar HC granted bail to Khan, against whom 14 cases have been registered on charges that he incited violence, on surety of PKR 50,000. Khan had organised rally to demand expedited general elections.

202.title: Those who'll watch Samrat Prithviraj tomorrow; don't give spoilers: Akshay
202.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Thursday shared a note for his fans and followers ahead of the release of his film 'Samrat Prithviraj'. Taking to Instagram, Akshay wrote, "This is our sincere request to everyone watching the film from tomorrow, to not give out spoilers that reveal several aspects of our film that are designed to be awe-inspiring."

203.title: Mumbai sees 704 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.37%
203.article_body: Mumbai reported 704 new cases of COVID-19 on Thursday as compared to 739 cases recorded the previous day. The positivity rate stood at 7.37%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases rose to 3,324. On Wednesday, the city reported the highest daily rise in cases after February 4 and the active cases were reported at 2,970.

204.title: Huge explosion, fire at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Vadodara; pics surface
204.article_body: Huge explosion and fire have been reported at Deepak Nitrite Company's plant located at Nandesari Gujarat Industrial Development Corporation (GIDC) in Vadodara. Fire tenders have been rushed to the spot as 10 people have reportedly been hurt and many are feared trapped. The Vadodara Highway has been closed off due to the fire.

205.title: I had a weak govt, was blackmailed from everywhere as we didn't have power: Imran Khan
205.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that he had a weak government. "Our hands were tied. We were blackmailed from everywhere. Power wasn't with us. Everyone knows where the power lies in Pakistan so we had to rely on them," he stated. Khan was replaced by PML-N's Shehbaz Sharif as Pakistan PM.

206.title: Pollard tweets 'Hope followers increased' to his critic Aakash Chopra, deletes it later
206.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard took to Twitter to take a dig at Aakash Chopra, who had criticised his performance in IPL 2022 and had said, "I think we have seen the last of Pollard." Pollard, in a now-deleted tweet, wrote, "Hope the fan base and followers increased @cricketaakash...keep it flowing!"

207.title: Over 1 million people are displaced in Myanmar: UN report
207.article_body: The number of people displaced within Myanmar has exceeded 1 million for the first time, UN's new report has stated. The figure includes almost 7 lakh people displaced by violence and insecurity since military seized power in a coup last year, the report claimed. "The impact on civilians is worsening daily with frequent...attacks...involving explosive hazards, including landmines," report read.

208.title: Alia Bhatt's performance in Gangubai Kathiawadi was superb: Kartik
208.article_body: When asked about the last time an actor's performance humbled him, actor Kartik Aaryan said, "I can't think of just one. There are so many great actors in our industry and so many of my contemporaries have been giving some amazing performances." "Alia Bhatt's [performance] in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'...was just superb, and so many more," Kartik said.

209.title: Levying service charge is illegal, end practice immediately: Govt to restaurants
209.article_body: The Centre on Thursday told the National Restaurant Association of India that the service charge levied by restaurants on consumers is illegal and asked the restaurants to end the practice immediately, PTI reported. The government stated that it will soon come up with a "robust framework to ensure strict compliance by the stakeholders" as the issue adversely affects consumers daily.

210.title: 4 Indians killed in Tara Air flight crash cremated at Nepal temple
210.article_body: The bodies of four Indians, who were among 22 people killed in Tara Air flight crash on May 29, were cremated at Kathmandu's Pashupatinath temple on Thursday. The deceased, Ashok Kumar Tripathi and his estranged wife Vaibhavi, were onboard the flight with their children as the family was on a court-ordered holiday. Ashok's relatives were present for the last rites.

211.title: Who is Camille Vasquez, Johnny Depp's lawyer in defamation trial against Amber Heard?
211.article_body: Camille Vasquez, Johnny Depp's lawyer in his defamation trial against Amber Heard, hails from Los Angeles, California. She attended the University of Southern California and Southwestern Law School. Camille started working with Brown Rudnick LLP as an associate attorney in 2018. "Her current practice focuses on plaintiff-side defamation suits," the firm's website reads.

212.title: Kashmiri Pandits hold protests in J&K, threaten mass migration over targeted killings
212.article_body: Kashmiri Pandits, including the employees who were given jobs under a PM's package for the community, held protests and threatened mass migration after targeted killings in J&K. Many of them have left the valley, according to reports. A 26-year-old bank manager from Rajasthan was shot dead inside the bank by a terrorist on Thursday.

213.title: Lost appendix not sense of humour: Nakuul shares health update post surgery
213.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Nakuul Mehta shared his health update with his fans post his surgery and wrote, "We went from celebration to hospitalisation in a span of 24 hours...I'm overwhelmed with...the messages...It may take me a few days to get to them whilst I regain my strength...However...the good news is that we've...lost our appendix...not our sense of humour!"

214.title: Don't dare to cross limits: Pak PM to Khan on 'breaking Pak' remark
214.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday warned his predecessor Imran Khan against making "naked threats" about the country's division, adding that Khan shouldn't "dare to cross limits". Sharif's remark came in response to Khan's comment that Pakistan may break into three parts if government doesn't make right decisions. He had also said that Pakistan could lose its nuclear deterrent capabilities.

215.title: ExpressVPN removes VPN services in India as refusal to comply with govt order
215.article_body: ExpressVPN on Thursday announced it has removed its virtual private network (VPN) servers in India. This is in response to a recent data law introduced in India requiring VPN providers to store user information for at least five years. "Our users will still be able to connect to VPN servers that will give them Indian IP addresses," said ExpressVPN.

216.title: CBI files charge sheet against Anil Deshmukh in ₹100-cr bribery case
216.article_body: The CBI has filed a charge sheet against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh and others in a ₹100-crore bribery case, officials said. This comes after a special CBI court allowed dismissed Mumbai Police officer Sachin Vaze to turn an approver and seek pardon in the case. Deshmukh and his two staffers were arrested by the CBI in April.

217.title: Preity shares old pic from her school days, says 'It made me feel so grown up'
217.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta on Thursday shared a throwback picture of hers with her friend and her mother. Sharing the photo, she wrote, "I remember taking this photo after passing out of school. I was...excited to be in college even though I was still in 11th grade. Made me feel so grown up. Love this photo @shagunkhanna. Miss you, Paddy aunty."

218.title: Caste-based census in Bihar to be completed by Feb 2023, state to spend ₹500 cr
218.article_body: The Bihar Cabinet has decided to complete the caste-based census in the state by February next year. The government will spend ₹500 crore on it from the contingency fund, the cabinet has decided. On Wednesday, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that a caste-based count will be held in the state by a set deadline.

219.title: Kiya.ai launches Kiyaverse, India's first banking metaverse
219.article_body: Kiya.ai has announced the launch of India's first-ever banking metaverse named Kiyaverse. Kiyaverse hopes to merge use cases of real-world banking with metaverse banking through avatar-based interactions. Kiya.ai MD and CEO Rajesh Mirjankar said the firm's product roadmap includes integration with Central Bank Digital Currency and interoperability with other metaverses to enable open finance.

220.title: CBDCs would kill case for private cryptos' existence: RBI Deputy Guv
220.article_body: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) would "actually...kill whatever little case there could be for private cryptocurrencies", said RBI Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Thursday. Sankar also reiterated RBI's view that private cryptocurrencies shouldn't be permitted "just because they're backed by hi-tech". "Any tool that can be used for good can also be put to undesirable uses," he added.

221.title: He married 4 months ago, didn't even get his wedding album: Father of bank manager killed in J&K
221.article_body: After 26-year-old bank manager Vijay Kumar Beniwal from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam, his father said Vijay got married nearly four months ago and "even his wedding photo album wasn't ready yet." "He got married on February 10 and left for a job after 10 days. He recently took his wife with him," his father added.

222.title: Singers don't have power, they need godfather: Indian Idol winner Abhijeet
222.article_body: Indian Idol winner Abhijeet Sawant in an interview said his career didn't turn out the way he hoped because he has always been burdened with the tag of being a reality show winner. "The playback industry offers...lot of opportunities but at the same time, you need...a godfather," he added. "In this industry, singers don’t have much power," Abhijeet said.

223.title: 3 men arrested with 23 kg marijuana in separate cases in Pune
223.article_body: Three people were arrested and around 23 kg of marijuana was seized along with sharp weapons in separate incidents in Pune. In the first case, police seized around 21 kg of marijuana worth over ₹4.2 lakh from a 32-year-old man in Hingne. In the second case, two accused were arrested with 1.6 kg of marijuana.

224.title: Pic shows Johnny Depp's legal team hugging each other after he wins defamation trial
224.article_body: Johnny Depp's legal team celebrated inside a Virginia courtroom immediately after a jury ruled in favour of the actor's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard. Visuals from the court showed several attorneys on Depp's team smiling and group-hugging after the verdict was read. Depp was not in the courtroom to hear the verdict in his defamation case against Heard.

225.title: Pod hotel services likely to open at Mumbai's CSMT this month
225.article_body: A pod hotel, also known as a capsule hotel, is being developed at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) and is likely to be opened for public this month, Central Railway officials said. This pod hotel will have a capacity of 50 persons, the officials added. In November 2021, a pod hotel was opened at the Mumbai Central railway station.

226.title: Highly condemnable: Rajasthan CM on bank manager's killing in J&K
226.article_body: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot condemned the killing of a Rajasthan resident in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district and called the incident "highly condemnable". "I pray to God to give peace to his soul and courage to his family," Gehlot tweeted. Vijay Kumar, a bank manager from Rajasthan, was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam inside the bank premises.

227.title: Those who should protect Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting film: Rahul
227.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said those who should be protecting Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting a film (The Kashmir Files). Referring to the targeted killings in Kashmir, Gandhi said, "Bank manager, teacher and many other innocent people are being killed everyday, Kashmiri Pandits are fleeing." "Take immediate steps to restore peace in Kashmir, Prime Minister ji," he added.

228.title: 20 'mini-forests' to be built in Ghaziabad by the end of 2022
228.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation is planning to create 20 'mini-forests' across the city by the end of this year to improve the greenery and forest cover, officials said. Officials added that four other plantation sites which were developed as a pilot project, showed a plant survival rate of about 95%. The plantation drive at these sites was initiated in 2021.

229.title: 45-yr-old Noida man arrested for assaulting his 70-yr-old mother
229.article_body: Police said that they arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly assaulting his 70-year-old mother at their house in Noida. The accused, Manoj, got into a fight with his mother Jagvati Devi on May 28, after which he assaulted her with a stick and other heavy objects, police added. A video of the woman's injuries was shared on social media platforms.

230.title: US, NZ smeared our cooperation with Pacific countries: China
230.article_body: China on Wednesday accused the US and New Zealand of "smearing" its cooperation with Pacific nations. China's reaction comes in response to a joint statement by US President Joe Biden and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern, expressing concern about possible Chinese military presence in the Pacific. Notably, 10 Pacific countries recently refused to sign trade and security deal with China.

231.title: Man gets life term for killing his factory owner's wife in Thane
231.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Manoranjan Mahakand, was sentenced to life imprisonment by a court in Maharashtra's Thane for killing his factory owner's wife in 2016. Additional public prosecutor told the court that Mahakand visited his factory owner's house often and fell in love with his wife. During such visit, he suspected her of being in love with someone and killed her.

232.title: Hyd student kills self allegedly after being harassed by TRS corporator
232.article_body: A B.Tech student in Hyderabad allegedly died by suicide after hanging himself from the ceiling in his house on Thursday. The family of the victim, Sharath, has alleged that he killed himself over harassment by a Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) corporator. Reportedly, the corporator attacked the student over a civil dispute two days ago.

233.title: Modi government is behaving worse than Congress: AIADMK
233.article_body: The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan criticised its ally BJP saying PM Narendra Modi-led government at the Centre is behaving worse than Congress. Calling BJP anti-Tamil, Ponnaiyan said, "Tamil Nadu should be given an exemption in language policy." He further alleged that the BJP is continuously "imposing" Hindi despite AIADMK's opposition.

234.title: Heatwave warning issued for 6 states; IMD releases list
234.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heatwave conditions in isolated pockets of Rajasthan on June 3. The IMD also said that heatwave condition is likely over south Punjab, south Haryana, south Uttar Pradesh and north Madhya Pradesh on June 3 and 4 and over Maharashtra till June 5. Rainfall has been predicted in several states on Thursday.

235.title: Hrithik's cousin Pashmina Roshan to make her B'wood debut with Ishq Vishk sequel
235.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's cousin Pashmina Roshan will make her acting debut with Shahid's 'Ishq Vishk' sequel, along with Rohit Saraf, Jibraan Khan, and Naila Grewal. Sharing the video announcement on Instagram, Pashmina wrote, "I'm extremely excited...to bring to you my first experience on screen." Congratulating Pashmina, her uncle, filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, commented, "Congratulations to all."

236.title: Monsoon enters northeast, heavy rains likely in Assam, Meghalaya: IMD
236.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday said southwest monsoon has entered northeast India and is set to bring heavy rains over Assam and Meghalaya over next two days. IMD has forecast fairly widespread rainfall over coastal and south interior Karnataka, Kerala, Mahe and Lakshadweep over next five days. Heatwave warnings have been issued over Rajasthan, south Punjab and south Haryana.

237.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passes away aged 73 due to cancer
237.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passed away on Thursday aged 73. "He was suffering from colon cancer. He...would have celebrated his 74th birthday on June 22," his son Abhay Sopori stated. He added that his father passed away at 3:30 pm and was "ailing in the hospital for the last three weeks".

238.title: You cannot belittle any language: Kamal Haasan on national language debate
238.article_body: Sharing that language is a part of a person's culture and community, actor Kamal Haasan said, "A language is far more ingrained in a person, it's part of his culture. It's bigger than community sometimes. You cannot belittle any language." "I'm...proud (of our national anthem) but I don't question why the national anthem isn't there in my language," he added.

239.title: Gerard  Piqué caught cheating by Shakira, couple set to separate: Report
239.article_body: Singer Shakira and footballer Gerard  Piqué are on the verge of splitting up after she caught him cheating with another woman a few weeks back, said reports. As per a report in El Periodico, Piqué moved out from the house he shares with Shakira and has been living alone in Barcelona. The report claimed that Piqué lives a "party lifestyle".

240.title: Russia occupies 20% of Ukraine's territory: Zelenskyy
240.article_body: Russia now occupies about 20% of Ukraine's territory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said while addressing Luxembourg's Parliament on Thursday. The front lines of battle are stretched across over 1,000 kilometres, he added. "We have to defend ourselves against almost the entire Russian army. All combat-ready Russian military formations are involved in this aggression," he further said.

241.title: After UP, Madhya Pradesh makes Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' tax-free
241.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday announced that 'Samrat Prithviraj', featuring actor Akshay Kumar and actress Manushi Chhillar, will be made tax-free in the state. 
Chouhan said the decision was taken so that more people watch the movie. Earlier in the day, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath declared the movie tax-free.

242.title: Bank manager Vijay 8th victim of targeted killings in J&K since May 1
242.article_body: Vijay Kumar, a bank manager who was shot dead by a terrorist in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam on Thursday, is eighth victim of targeted killings in Kashmir since May 1. On May 31, a female teacher was shot dead at a school in Kulgam. A man was killed after terrorists attacked a newly-opened wine shop in Baramulla on May 17.

243.title: UN approves request to change Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye'
243.article_body: UN on Wednesday approved Turkey's request to change its official name to 'Türkiye', Stephane Dujarric, spokesman for UN chief Antonio Guterres said. Dujarric stated the name change became effective after UN received Turkish government's letter requesting use of 'Türkiye' for all affairs. "Türkiye is the best representation...of...[our]...culture," President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had earlier said.

244.title: He's had a disgusting year at every level: Jerome Rothen on Messi
244.article_body: Ex-PSG player Jerome Rothen said PSG forward Lionel Messi has had a disgusting year at every level. "If you can't run, don't come to the field...On the field, you're judged as a 100 [percent] player," added Rothen. "The concern for adaptation can happen to all players. But we are talking about the best player on the football planet," stated Rothen.

245.title: Rather good news: Real Madrid's Hazard on Mbappé not joining Madrid
245.article_body: Real Madrid forward Eden Hazard said Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappé's decision to extend his contract with PSG rather than signing for Madrid is "good" news. "Competition for places is already tough at Real but with...Mbappé they would have become even more tough," added Hazard. Real Madrid president Florentino Perez earlier said that Mbappé has "already been forgotten".

246.title: 10-yr-old boy bitten by snake in Kerala school on 2nd day of reopening
246.article_body: A 10-year-old boy was bitten by a snake inside the premises of a government school in Kerala's Thrissur district. The incident occurred on Thursday, a day after schools in the state reopened for the new academic year. The child was reportedly bitten by a viper after alighting from the school bus. He was rushed to a government hospital, reports added.

247.title: Wish you a speedy recovery: PM Modi to Sonia Gandhi after she tests COVID-19 positive
247.article_body: After Congress announced that the party's interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Wishing Congress President Smt Sonia Gandhi Ji a speedy recovery from COVID-19." Congress said that she developed mild symptoms and has isolated herself, adding, "As of today, her date of appearance before Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is."

248.title: Western viewers tweet RRR is a gay movie, Ram Gopal Varma says 'I was right'
248.article_body: After several viewers from West took to Twitter to say that 'RRR' is a gay movie, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma tweeted, saying, "I was right." Varma attached a news report about people calling the movie gay with his tweet. "Jaw-dropping action, yes...Adventure, yes...Revenge, yes...But why did none of you tell me RRR movie was so heartwarmingly gay??" a viewer wrote.

249.title: Delhivery shares surge 15%, touch their highest-ever price of ₹617
249.article_body: Shares of Delhivery rose to their highest-ever price of ₹617.35/share on Thursday after Credit Suisse initiated coverage with an 'outperform' rating. Shares of Delhivery, which were listed on May 24, were up ₹81.7, or 15%, compared with its closing price of ₹535.65 recorded on Wednesday. The shares have risen 26.7% from their IPO issue price of ₹487/share.

250.title: Mobile app developed to alert people about lightning, give trigger warnings
250.article_body: Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM-Pune) and Earth System Science Organisation (ESSO) under Ministry of Earth Sciences have developed Damini mobile application to alert people about lightning. Reports said the app alerts users about lightning near them by GPS notification under 20 km and 40 km and also gives trigger warnings about lightning strikes one or two hours in advance.

251.title: Who is 44-year-old Javier Olivan, Meta's next COO?
251.article_body: Javier Olivan, who is replacing Sheryl Sandberg as Meta's next COO, has been working with the company since October 2007. Olivan, who hails from Spain, did his electrical and industrial engineering from University of Navarra and MBA from Stanford University. Before joining Facebook in late 2007 as head of international growth, the 44-year-old worked at Japan's NTT and Siemens.

252.title: KK felt unwell, wanted to leave but wasn't allowed: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
252.article_body: Following singer KK’s demise in Kolkata, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Thursday said the singer was "forced to sing despite complaining of uneasiness". "He was feeling unwell and sweating. He wanted to leave but was not allowed. He was murdered," Ghosh added. Meanwhile, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "It's BJP’s culture to engage in such cheap and ugly politics over death."

253.title: Rachakonda Police wishes people on Telangana Formation Day
253.article_body: The Rachakonda Police greeted the people on the occasion of the Telangana Formation Day on Thursday. "Salutes to all those martyrs who sacrificed their lives for the state," the police said on Twitter. Earlier in the day, CM K Chandrashekar Rao hoisted the national flag and paid tributes to martyrs who sacrificed their lives during the separate state movement.

254.title: South Africa President accused of 'kidnapping' & bribing burglars
254.article_body: An ex-South African spy agency chief has sued President Cyril Ramaphosa for allegedly "kidnapping" and bribing robbers who stole $4 million from one of his properties. Arthur Fraser alleged that burglars broke into Ramaphosa's Johannesburg farm on February 9, 2020. Following this, Ramaphosa organised "kidnapping of suspects, their interrogation on his property" and later paid them to stay quiet.

255.title: I'll give 9/10 to Du Plessis for his captaincy in IPL 2022: Aakash
255.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said Faf Du Plessis absorbed the pressure of leading RCB and was a very good captain in IPL 2022. "Faf's captaincy was good...9/10 for [his] captaincy...he got the best out of his players. I think he [also] created a great environment in the side," added Aakash. RCB lost to RR in Qualifier 2 of the tournament.

256.title: Yes Bank plans to sell pool of stressed assets to JC Flowers: Report
256.article_body: Yes Bank is planning to sell a pool of stressed assets worth ₹48,000 crore to US-based JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction Company (ARC), BQ Prime reported. JC Flowers has agreed to place a ₹12,400-crore bid against the stressed assets on sale, ensuring a 25% recovery. Yes Bank will have to invest ₹300-400 crore in the ARC as part of the deal.

257.title: Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar: BJP leader to Maha CM
257.article_body: BJP leader Gopichand Padalkar has written a letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray demanding that Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar. "She reconstructed temples that were destroyed by Muslim rulers. Thus, Ahmednagar should be renamed, as a tribute to her, as Ahilyanagar," Padalkar wrote. "Hindurajmata Punyashlok Ahilyadevi Holkar is an inspiration for Hindustan," he added.

258.title: After Moosewala's murder, Punjab govt to restore security cover of 400 VVIPs from June 7
258.article_body: Punjab government on Thursday told the Punjab and Haryana High Court that it will restore the security cover of over 420 VVIPs from June 7. This comes after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa on Sunday, a day after the state government had withdrawn the security cover of 424 VVIPs in Punjab with immediate effect.

259.title: Biden announces new $700 million weapons package for Ukraine
259.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced a new weapons package worth $700 million for Ukraine to help it fight Russian forces. The package includes high mobility artillery rocket systems which, Ukraine has assured, will not be used against targets on Russian territory, according to the US. The US will continue to provide Ukraine with weapons to defend itself, said Biden.

260.title: India will send fertilisers to Sri Lanka to avert food shortages
260.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office said on Thursday that India has assured the supply of fertilisers to avert food shortages. This comes days after Sri Lankan government requested farmers to boost paddy cultivation. Sri Lanka, which is reeling under a forex crisis, needs an estimated $600 million to import fertilisers, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe had earlier said.

261.title: Nobody's safe: J&K govt employees protest, demand transfer to home districts
261.article_body: Several government employees posted in Kashmir carried out a march on Thursday to protest against the recent targeted killings in the valley and demanded a transfer to their respective home districts. "We are serving there for...15 years but...feeling insecure...in view of...spurt in...targeted killings," a protestor said. "Nobody, including Muslims, Hindus and Sikhs are safe," he added.

262.title: Amit Shah meets NSA Ajit Doval amid targeted killings in Kashmir
262.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday met National Security Advisor Ajit Doval amid targeted killings in Kashmir. The meeting lasted for over an hour. Shah will meet Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha with other security officials, including RAW chief Samant Goel, over the issue on Friday.

263.title: I'd request for auditoriums to have medical facilities: Abhijeet on KK's death
263.article_body: After singer KK's death, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya said that he would like to request auditoriums that have large crowds to have a medical van and medical facilities. He also said that he is a big fan of KK and the late singer's songs are often played in his house. He added that his son also tries to sing KK's songs.

264.title: Self-destructive: Moscow on EU's move to phase out Russian oil
264.article_body: Russia has called the European Union's move to cut 90% of oil imports from Russia by year-end "self-destructive". "The European Union's decisions to partially phase out Russian oil and oil products, as well as to ban insurance on Russian merchant ships, are highly likely to provoke further price increases, destabilise energy markets, and disrupt supply chains," Russian Foreign Ministry said.

265.title: India's digital payment industry to reach $10 tn by 2026: Report
265.article_body: A report by PhonePe in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group (BCG) has said that India's digital payments market is at an "inflection point" and is expected to more than triple from the current $3 trillion to $10 trillion by 2026. Digital payments' overall share will reportedly grow to 65% in 2026 and will constitute two out of three payment transactions.

266.title: Canada accuses Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft
266.article_body: The Canadian military on Wednesday accused Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft on a UN mission to monitor sanctions against North Korea. The Chinese aircraft approached the Canadian plane on several occasions between April 26 and May 26, it said. On some occasions, the Canadian plane had to quickly change course to avoid collision, it added.

267.title: People said Welcome wasn't funny, I was in hospital due to high BP: Anees
267.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Welcome', the film's director Anees Bazmee said, "Nobody liked it after the first...screening. I asked them what they didn't like...and they said, 'It's not funny at all'." "I became stressed about taking the film to the public...[and got hospitalised] because of high blood pressure," added Anees. "We released the film without any changes," stated Anees.

268.title: He's becoming Paigambar: CPI (M) leader on Assam CM's Muslim marriages remark
268.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Thursday criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma for his remark on Muslim marriages. "Assam CM is becoming the Paigambar (religious leader), not Chief Minister. Every day he's giving advice on different religions," he said. Sarma had recently said his government is clear that no Muslim man should marry three women.

269.title: Imran Khan warns of 'civil war' in Pakistan if polls not announced
269.article_body: Pakistan's ousted PM Imran Khan has warned that the country "will go towards [a] civil war" if fresh elections were not announced. He also said that there was "no question" of returning to the National Assembly as that would "mean accepting the conspiracy" that had removed his government. Khan was ousted through a no-trust vote on April 10.

270.title: Aditya is the best companion one could ask for: Yami on her husband
270.article_body: Speaking about her anniversary plans with her husband, filmmaker Aditya Dhar, actress Yami Gautam said, "My mother is in town, Aditya's parents are there...and our entire family is here. So we [will] have a small lunch at home, there will be a small puja." "You feel...happy when you know you're with the best companion you could ask for," she added.

271.title: People were talking about him retiring: Sania on Bopanna reaching French Open semis
271.article_body: Ahead of Rohan Bopanna's men's doubles semi-final match at French Open on Thursday, India's Sania Mirza said she's very happy to see the 42-year-old still playing at the highest level. "I'm so happy to see him play at this level, you know, when people [were] talking about him retiring...[he has] a legit shot at the [doubles] title," stated Mirza.

272.title: Congress councillor held for creating ruckus in Telangana theatre
272.article_body: Police arrested Congress party councillor Jonny Pasha for allegedly creating ruckus inside a theatre in Telangana's Nalgonda. "Jonny Pasha had a fight with three persons in a theatre...When we reached the spot, police tried to stop him but he did not listen and created a ruckus there," said Superintendent of Police, Nalgonda. Three people received minor injuries in the incident.

273.title: Accused entitled to call records at start of trial: Punjab and Haryana HC
273.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that an accused is entitled to be provided with call records at the beginning of the trial.  The accused has to build up his defence right from the very inception after charges are framed, it added. HC was hearing a plea from a person whose application to provide call records was dismissed.

274.title: Ayan didn't show me Brahmastra but showed to my dad, I'm upset: Rajamouli
274.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli jokingly said he has a complaint against 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji for not showing him the film, despite Rajamouli coming to Mumbai twice after the release of his film 'RRR'. "He showed the entire film to my father [KV Vijayendra Prasad]...(He laughed) I am quite upset with him," added Rajamouli. 'Brahmastra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

275.title: AAP leaders visiting Moosewala’s parents discretely: Punjab Congress
275.article_body: The Punjab Congress on Thursday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders have started "shedding crocodile tears" for late singer Sidhu Moosewala by paying a "discrete visit" to his parents, away from the public gaze. "Backdoor condolences!" Punjab Congress tweeted. Furthermore, the party said that the ruling AAP exposed Moosewala like a "sitting duck".

276.title: T'gana suffered extreme 'misgovernance' by TRS in last 8 yrs: Rahul
276.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, on the occasion of Telangana Formation Day, said the state was born out of people's aspirations for a better future. "In the last eight years, Telangana...suffered extreme misgovernance by TRS," Rahul added. He further reaffirmed Congress' commitment to build Telangana into a model state, ensuring prosperity for all, including farmers, poor and common people.

277.title: Old pic shows singer KK and director Kabir Khan on stage during their college days
277.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur, on Thursday, remembered singer KK with a throwback picture. It features the late singer along with Mini's filmmaker-husband Kabir Khan and another friend. Kabir and KK attended college together at Delhi University's Kirori Mal College. "As the world bids KK goodbye, some memories from the dancing as part of the ZEDDs that will always remain," wrote Mini.

278.title: Who is 23-year-old Dr Shagun Batra, the NEET-PG topper?
278.article_body: Dr Shagun Batra secured first rank in the NEET-PG exam, the results of which were declared on Wednesday. The 23-year-old enrolled in Delhi's Maulana Azad Medical College in 2016 and was the gold medallist from her MBBS batch, HT reported. She's an alumna of Delhi Public School (RK Puram) and was the school topper in her Class 12 Board exams.

279.title: China's Geely launches 1st 9 low-orbit satellites for self-driving cars
279.article_body: China-based Zhejiang Geely has launched its first nine low earth orbit satellites to build a satellite network to provide more accurate navigation for autonomous vehicles. Geely expects another 63 GeeSAT-1 satellites to be in orbit by 2025. The satellites have an operating lifespan of five years and will disintegrate in Earth's atmosphere without leaving any space debris.

280.title: Ambulances with hydraulic lifts to come up in Himachal to treat sick animals
280.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government has decided to start a network of veterinary ambulances across the state for treatment of sick and injured animals. Reports said the equipment needed for diagnosis, minor surgery and disease investigation will be installed in the ambulances. State Animal Husbandry Minister said the ambulances will have hydraulic lifts to shift animals to government facilities.

281.title: Over 550 cases of monkeypox reported from 30 countries so far: WHO
281.article_body: Over 550 confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported from 30 countries that aren't endemic to the virus, World Health Organisation (WHO) said on Wednesday. "Sudden appearance of monkeypox in many countries at the same time suggests there may have been undetected transmission for some time," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. Symptoms of monkeypox include rashes, lesions and fever.

282.title: Heartbreaking, mind-numbing: Omar on bank manager’s killing in J&K
282.article_body: After a bank manager from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Kulgam, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Thursday said it’s heartbreaking to see families destroyed like this. "Tweeting to condemn an attack and condole a death are becoming a mind-numbingly regular thing," Abdullah said. "Yet another targeted killing!" he added.

283.title: Visually impaired woman raped while trying to find a bus in Delhi
283.article_body: A visually impaired woman, who was trying to find the right bus to go home, was allegedly raped by the man who offered to help her in southwest Delhi, police said on Thursday. Police received information about the crime from a hospital. The accused was arrested and sent to judicial custody based on technical evidence collected from the spot.

284.title: Man who raped woman with sharp object & murdered her sentenced to death in Mumbai
284.article_body: A Mumbai court has sentenced a 45-year-old man to death after convicting him for raping and murdering a 30-year-old woman in Sakinaka in September last year. Convict Mohan Chauhan had raped the woman using a sharp object, following which she succumbed to her injuries. The police had also sought capital punishment for him.

285.title: Rajnath holds bilateral talks with Israeli Defence Minister in Delhi
285.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and his Israeli counterpart Benny Gantz held bilateral talks in Delhi on Thursday. Gantz, who's on a visit to India to mark 30 years of India-Israel diplomatic relations, discussed topics including military cooperation and strategic global challenges with Singh. Gantz also received a Tri-Service Guard of Honour and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial.

286.title: Running companies hurts my heart: World's richest person Elon Musk
286.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Running companies hurts my heart...but I don't see any other way to bring technology and design to fruition." After a Twitter user recalled Musk being replaced as CEO of X.com in 2000, Musk wrote, "I never wanted to be CEO...Bill Harris sounded like he'd be...great CEO, given his Intuit experience, but he wasn't."

287.title: Can't disclose reasons for security clearance denial to MediaOne TV: Govt
287.article_body: The Centre told the Supreme Court that it cannot disclose its reasons for the denial of security clearance to Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV. Such disclosure will have "unimaginable" and "far-reaching" consequences on national security, it added. SC in March had stayed the order denying security clearance to the channel. Centre had banned the MediaOne TV telecast citing security reasons.

288.title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake hits China; 4 killed, 41 injured
288.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 struck Ya'an city of China's Sichuan province on Wednesday, which left four people dead and 41 others injured, according to authorities. One of the injured persons is reportedly in critical condition, while 38 suffered minor injuries. A total of 13,081 people in the city are said to have been affected by the earthquake.

289.title: Delhi to replace 'Harijan' with 'Dr Ambedkar' in names of streets, colonies
289.article_body: Delhi Social Welfare Minister RP Gautam on Thursday said the government will soon issue a notification to replace the word 'Harijan' with 'Dr Ambedkar' in names of streets and colonies. Delhi will be one of the first states to curb the word's use, Gautam said. Law department officials have been instructed to complete the process within 10 days, he added.

290.title: 8-yr-old found hanging from window grille in Pune; suicide suspected
290.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was found hanging from a window grille with rope at his home in Pune district's Pimpri-Chinchwad. A doll which was strangled with a rope with its head covered with a cloth was lying next to him. Police said the investigation till now suggests that the boy may have strangled the doll and then hanged himself.

291.title: Govt considers panel to rule on appeals over social media takedowns
291.article_body: The central government is considering setting up an appeals panel that will have the power to reverse the content moderation decisions of social media firms, a document made public on Thursday revealed. It proposed one or more such panels and set a deadline of 30 days for appeals against decisions by company grievance officers.

292.title: TN man buys camel from Rajasthan, uses it to steal sand; booked
292.article_body: Police have booked a 52-year-old man for illegally carrying mined sand using a camel in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga. The accused had bought a male and female camel from Rajasthan with a thought of selling camel milk to residents around the town. But the female camel had a fracture and he couldn't supply milk, so he started smuggling sand, police said.

293.title: Hate speech on FB rises 38%, violent content on Instagram rises 86% in Apr
293.article_body: Facebook witnessed a 37.82% rise in hate speech content while Instagram saw an 86% rise in violent content in April 2022, a report released by their parent firm Meta said. Facebook took action against 53,200 hate speech-related content with a proactive rate of 82.2%. Instagram acted on 77,000 violence and incitement-related content with a proactive rate of 96.7%.

294.title: 3,400-year-old city reemerges from river after drought in Iraq; pics released
294.article_body: A 3,400-year-old city reemerged from a reservoir on the Tigris River after drought in Iraq. A team of archaeologists believed it to be the remnants of a city from the Mittani Kingdom, which ruled the region during the Bronze Age. Earlier this year, the team reportedly found evidence of a large city, including a storage complex, industrial building and fortifications.

295.title: Was a nightmare to face Wasim Akram: Ex-SL captain Mahela Jayawardena
295.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram was the "best" fast bowler he ever faced. "It was a nightmare to face him...because he is challenging you with the new ball, doesn't matter what format it is. He had a really quick-arm action and...the ability to beat you any time of the day," added Jayawardena.

296.title: Pune hospital's employee issues fake disability certificate; booked
296.article_body: An employee of the Sassoon hospital in Pune has been booked for allegedly issuing a fake disability certificate to a person. The action was taken based on a complaint from hospital authorities. The accused worked as a data operator at a department responsible for issuing disability certificates after collecting essential documents from applicants.

297.title: Paul Pogba to leave Manchester United at the end of June
297.article_body: Paul Pogba will leave Manchester United on a free transfer when his contract expires at the end of June. This is the second time Pogba is leaving United for free, the first being in 2012 when he joined Juventus. He returned in 2016 for a then-world-record fee of £89.3 million. Pogba has scored 39 goals in 233 appearances for United.

298.title: Allu Arjun should work with me: Akshay on South films dominating Hindi market
298.article_body: During the promotions of 'Samrat Prithiviraj', actor Akshay Kumar was reportedly asked about South films dominating the Hindi market. He said, "Stop creating...divide and rule kind of scenario in the country. There's nothing called south and north, we all are one as an industry." "Allu Arjun should work with me soon and I'll act with another south actor," he added.

299.title: UPI transactions cross ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time in May
299.article_body: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) saw transactions worth ₹10.41 lakh crore in May 2022, crossing the ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time ever, data from National Payments Corporation of India showed. A total of 595 crore transactions were recorded in May 2022, up 134.5% from 254 crore transactions recorded in May 2021. UPI transactions also breached the $1-trillion mark in FY22.

300.title: Conspiracy theorist: Smriti on Kejriwal's 'Sisodia to be arrested' claim
300.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said as per reliable sources AAP's Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon in "fake cases", Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "Conspiracy theorist strikes back!" "It would be easier to come out ‘clean’ for once instead of peddling fake sob stories which do not have any takers anymore," Irani tweeted.

301.title: 3-yr-old dies of encephalitis in Muzaffarpur, toll reaches 4 in Bihar
301.article_body: A three-year-old girl, Shivani Kumari, died of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. With this, total number of deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis (JE) and AES, a cluster of brain-related diseases, has gone up to four this year. Shivani was admitted to hospital on May 31 and died on the same day, pointing to a delay in getting hospitalised.

302.title: Govt relaxes educational criteria for Chhattisgarh tribals to join CRPF
302.article_body: Union Cabinet on Wednesday relaxed eligibility criteria for tribals from Chhattisgarh to join the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF). As per the guidelines, the educational requirement for Constable (General Duty) has been relaxed from Class 10 to Class 8 for native tribal youths of Bijapur, Dantewada and Sukma. With this, 400 tribal youths will get employment opportunities, the government said.

303.title: Depp spotted in UK pub moments before winning $15 mn in defamation trial, pic surfaces
303.article_body: Johnny Depp was spotted in a UK pub moments before winning a defamation lawsuit against Amber Heard. In another video, Depp was seen leaving the pub shortly before the verdict. Depp was awarded $15 million by the court. The actor had sued Heard over a 2018 op-ed in which she described herself as "a public figure representing domestic abuse".

304.title: Shreyas Iyer buys Mercedes-Benz G 63 for over ₹2.45 crore, pic surfaces
304.article_body: Team India batter and KKR captain Shreyas Iyer bought Mercedes-Benz G 63 for over ₹2.45 crore. Iyer also owns a Lamborghini and an Audi S5, as per reports. Iyer bought the Mercedes following the conclusion of IPL 2022, in which he scored 401 runs in 14 innings. KKR had finished seventh on the points table.

305.title: Data operator at Pune hospital issues fake disability certificate; booked
305.article_body: Police have booked a data operator at Pune's Sassoon hospital for allegedly issuing a fake disability certificate to a person. The operator was booked following a complaint from the hospital authorities. Police suspect that the accused issued the certificate in exchange for money. The suspect has been booked under sections 417, 465, 466, and 468 of the Indian Penal Code.

306.title: World's top 10 neglected refugee crises all in Africa: Report
306.article_body: In a first, 10 African nations have topped a list comprising of countries with world's 'most neglected' displacement crises, according to Norwegian Refugee Council's annual report. The Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has topped list for a second time, followed by Burkina Faso, Cameroon and South Sudan. Chad, Mali, Sudan, Nigeria, Burundi and Ethiopia are other countries on list.

307.title: CCTV footage of terrorist firing at bank manager in Kashmir surfaces
307.article_body: A CCTV footage of the terrorist attack on bank manager Vijay Kumar in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam has surfaced online. The video shows the terrorist in face mask peeking inside the bank and appearing to leave before he barges into the building once again and shoots at Kumar. Police said Vijay Kumar was a resident of Hanumangarh in Rajasthan.

308.title: Don't call me for statements on KK, can't talk about him in past tense: Vishal
308.article_body: Singer Vishal Dadlani took to Twitter to request media to stop calling him for statements on late singer KK. "I can't speak about him in the past tense...I simply don't have the strength," Vishal wrote. "The tears won't stop. What a guy he was. What a voice...what a heart, what a human being. KK is forever!!!" he had earlier tweeted.

309.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family writes to Amit Shah, seeks investigation by central agency
309.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's family has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah for a probe by a central agency into the singer's murder, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said. Shekhawat recently met the family of Moosewala, who was also a Congress leader. Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

310.title: A new face stepped up in every match: Shami on GT's IPL 2022 win
310.article_body: GT pacer Mohammad Shami said a new face stepped up in most of their games in IPL 2022, helping them win the title in their inaugural season. "For every team, their senior players...[performed]. But for Gujarat...new [faces stepped] up," stated Shami. "The bonding that we formed right from day one has been managed really well by the management," he added.

311.title: Man looking for frisbees in a lake killed by alligator in US
311.article_body: A man looking for frisbees in the water along a lakeshore in US' Florida was allegedly killed by an alligator, officials said, adding that there were posted signs of no swimming in the lake. The man's corpse, with one arm ripped off, was discovered on Tuesday morning. This was reportedly the first fatal alligator attack in Florida since 2019.

312.title: UP CM Yogi makes 'Samrat Prithviraj' tax-free after watching it with cabinet
312.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday announced that actor Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' will be tax-free in the state. He watched the movie with his cabinet colleagues at a special screening at the Raj Bhawan. Adityanath added that the decision to make the movie tax-free was taken so that a common man can also watch this movie.

313.title: Pakistan will break in 3 parts if right decisions not made: Imran
313.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that the country will be broken into three parts if the government does not make the right decisions. "If the establishment does not take the right decision, then…they will be destroyed and the armed forces will be the first ones to be devastated," he said during a TV interview.

314.title: 2 brothers of ex-BJP MLA shot dead in Patna
314.article_body: Two brothers of former BJP MLA Chitranjan Kumar were shot dead in Patna on Tuesday. The two - Shambhu Sharan (32) and Gautam Singh (28) - were returning home from office on a bike, when some motorcycle-borne perpetrators opened fire on them, said police. "An FIR has been lodged against seven persons. All belong to a rival gang," said police.

315.title: Singer KK cremated in Mumbai, son Nakul performs last rites
315.article_body: Singer KK, who passed away at the age of 53 in Kolkata on Tuesday, was cremated at the Versova Hindu Cemetery in Mumbai's Andheri on Thursday. KK's son Nakul performed his father's last rites. KK passed away due to a suspected cardiac arrest after performing at a concert in Kolkata.

316.title: Amazon to shut Kindle e-bookstore in China in 2023
316.article_body: Amazon will shut its Kindle e-bookstore in China in 2023 and will stop supplying retailers with Kindle e-readers, starting today. The Kindle e-bookstore will stop selling ebooks from June 30, 2023. However, customers will be able to continue downloading any purchased books for a year beyond that. The Kindle app will also be removed from Chinese app stores in 2024.

317.title: IIT Guwahati develops device to turn wastewater into energy
317.article_body: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have developed a bio-electrochemical device, Microbial Fuel Cell (MFC) that generates green energy by treating wastewater. MFC is an eco-friendly device that offers dual benefit of bioelectricity generation and waste management. "After scaling the process, it can be used as a source of clean energy using municipal wastewater...economically," Director, IIT Guwahati said.

318.title: Liquor, bhang shops near Sri Krishna Janmabhoomi in Mathura shut down
318.article_body:
To comply with the ban imposed on liquor vends in areas declared as 'teerth' by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, the district Excise Office on Wednesday shut down about 29 shops 
selling liquor, beer and 'bhang' in the vicinity of Sri Krishna Janmabhoomi in Mathura. Reports said that meat shops had already been closed in the area.

319.title: 1 dead, 2 missing after boat capsizes in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa
319.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after a rowboat with six people on board capsized in Tamas river in Rewa district of Madhya Pradesh. While three people swam to safety, two others went missing, reports added. The incident occurred on Wednesday noon when the boat was on its way to Gurguda village from Hardahan village, said Superintendent of Police, Navneet Bhasin.

320.title: Assam govt very clear that no Muslim man should marry 3 women: CM
320.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state government is very clear about certain things like no Muslim man should marry three women. "Don’t give talaq, give divorce legally. An equal share of the property should be given to daughters like sons," Sarma added. "Views of the government and the common Muslims are the same," Sarma stated.

321.title: Playing in the same team as Symonds made you feel bulletproof: Watson
321.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said playing in the same team as late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds made one feel "bulletproof". "He was so...incredibly good," added Watson. "Symonds was very much Viv Richards reincarnated in the way he played," he stated. "He always thought spin was there just to be smashed out of the ground," said Watson.

322.title: It’s our duty to watch film on Savarkar: Shiv Sena leader
322.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming movie 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', Shiv Sena leader Bharatshet Gogawale said Veer Savarkar is the pride of our nation and his work is legendary. "I feel it's our duty to watch a film that praised him and his work," Gogawale added. "A film on Savarkar is an excellent thing for all Hindus in this country," he stated.

323.title: SRPF jawan shoots colleague dead, kills self in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli
323.article_body: A 35-year-old State Reserve Police Force (SRPF) jawan, identified as Shrikant Berad, allegedly shot his 33-year-old colleague dead before killing himself with his service rifle in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday at Marpalli police post in Aheri tehsil, police added. The motive behind the incident is being ascertained, police further said.

324.title: KK had heart blockages, excitement during concert led to cardiac arrest: Doctor
324.article_body: KK, who passed away on Tuesday following a concert, had heart blockages, a doctor who conducted autopsy told PTI. "He had a major blockage in the left main coronary artery and small blockages in various other arteries and sub-arteries. Excessive excitement during the live show caused stoppage of blood flow leading to cardiac arrest that claimed his life," he stated.

325.title: Double-decker bus turned into classroom at govt school in Kerala
325.article_body: A double-decker bus belonging to Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has been converted into a high-tech classroom and a place for recreation for students at the Manacaud Government Lower Primary School. It is equipped with TV, air-conditioner, chairs with multi-coloured tables, benches and shelves for books. Its steering wheel and driver's seat have been retained to let children play.

326.title: McCullum messaged me asking if I was in: Moeen on Test cricket comeback
326.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali, who announced retirement from Test cricket last year, has revealed that England's newly-appointed Test coach Brendon McCullum has asked him if he would be available to play Tests again in future. "We spoke...[he asked] would I be available [in the future]? I said, 'Call me at the time'. We'll see...The door is open," stated Moeen.

327.title: Man sends child porn videos to women on FB, arrested by B'luru police
327.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a 40-year-old food delivery executive for allegedly sharing child pornographic material with women on Facebook. Purushotham was arrested after a report was shared by the National Crime Records Bureau. Purushotham used to randomly send friend requests to women on Facebook and after they accepted his request he'd send obscene photos and videos of children, police said.

328.title: Manish Sisodia gets portfolios allocated to Satyendar Jain after his arrest
328.article_body: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by Enforcement Directorate in an alleged money laundering case, portfolios allocated to him have now been handed over to Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. Meanwhile, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that after Jain, Sisodia is likely to be arrested too and "Centre has ordered agencies to form fake cases against him".

329.title: Sonia Gandhi tests COVID-19 +ve before ED appearance in money laundering case
329.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said, "She has developed mild fever and some symptoms and has isolated herself." He added, "As of today, her date of appearance before the Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is." The ED summoned Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case.

330.title: Kamal Haasan watches as Vikram trailer plays on Burj Khalifa, video surfaces
330.article_body: In a video shared online, actor Kamal Haasan can be seen standing and watching as the trailer of his movie 'Vikram' plays on Burj Khalifa. In the video, photographers can be seen clicking Haasan's pictures. People cheering from behind the camera can also be heard in the video. Haasan can also be seen smiling and talking to someone.

331.title: Workers, not politicians' children, will get preference in polls: Nadda
331.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday said the party will give preference to workers over children or family members of politicians in upcoming polls. "In Uttar Pradesh...children of many lawmakers were competent. Similar may be the case in MP. But we have to follow a policy," Nadda said. "We are against politics of dynasty," he added.

332.title: Had belief that I'm thinking them into victory: SRK on KKR's IPL title wins
332.article_body: Discussing KKR's IPL title wins in 2012 and 2014, the team's co-owner Shah Rukh Khan said, "I had this belief that I am thinking my team into victory...Both times it has happened that it goes numb!" Talking about KKR's win in the IPL 2014 final, KKR pacer Umesh Yadav said, "After Piyush Chawla scored that winning shot, there was...mayhem."

333.title: 2 labourers die as soil collapses at construction site in Gurugram
333.article_body: At least two labourers died after soil collapsed on them at an under-construction plot in Gurugram's Sector 57 on Wednesday, police said. "The basement had been dug over 10 feet below the ground level...labourers were putting pillars...when a mound of soil collapsed on them...they were trapped underneath," police added. It took over 15 minutes to retrieve their bodies, police stated.

334.title: Jinnah, Nehru divided country as act of wisdom: Congress leader
334.article_body: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma said that Muhammad Ali Jinnah and ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru "divided the country as an act of wisdom". "Jinnah was a freedom fighter and this should be remembered. He did not break the country but did the right thing," he added. "Does the definition of freedom fighter change because of one being a Muslim?" he stated.

335.title: 30-yr-old man kidnaps college student at gunpoint in Gurugram; arrested
335.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a female college student at gunpoint in Gurugram. According to police, the incident took place on Tuesday, when the victim was waiting for an auto-rickshaw outside her college. "When the accused saw...police chasing him, he dropped the victim at the Rampura flyover and escaped," said Civil Lines SHO Pankaj Kumar.

336.title: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel joins BJP
336.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, joined BJP on Thursday. Before joining BJP, Patel tweeted, "I will work as a small soldier under the leadership of the PM Narendra Modi." He added, "With the feelings of national interest, state interest, public interest and social interest, I am going to start a new chapter from today."

337.title: Vistara pilot lands plane without proper training, airline fined ₹10 lakh
337.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has imposed ₹10 lakh as fine on Vistara for letting an improperly trained pilot land an aircraft with passengers on board at the Indore airport. The pilot, who was the first officer, landed the aircraft without getting the requisite training in a simulator. "This was a serious violation endangering lives of the passengers on board," officials said.

338.title: Our history books filled with info on invaders, only 2-3 lines on our own kings: Akshay
338.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that history books in India are filled with information on invaders, adding that there are just two to three lines about our own kings. He added, "I'd like to appeal to Education Minister to look into this matter and see if we can balance it. We should know about Mughals, but know about our kings too."

339.title: UP govt official suspended over 'best junior engineer' pic of Osama bin Laden in office
339.article_body: Ravindra Prakash Gautam, sub-divisional officer (SDO) with the Dakshinanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Ltd (DVVNL), has been suspended after he placed a picture of Osama bin Laden in his office in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad district. A note below the picture read, "Respected Osama bin Laden, world's best junior engineer." The picture has been removed from his office, officials said.

340.title: Video shows toxic foam floating on surface of Yamuna river in Delhi
340.article_body: A layer of toxic foam was seen floating on the surface of the Yamuna river at ITO in Delhi. A video showing white coloured foam floating on the river has also reportedly gone viral on social media. Meanwhile, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that his government is aiming to treat all wastewater before it's discharged into Yamuna.

341.title: Request PM to jail all AAP MLAs at once, not 1 at a time: Kejriwal
341.article_body: Days after Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest, CM Arvind Kejriwal, in an apparent dig, asked PM Narendra Modi to jail all ministers and MLAs from AAP at one go. "Ask all central agencies to do all investigations at one go…Do as many raids as you want. You arrest one minister at a time, it obstructs public work," said Kejriwal.

342.title: Knew we'll hit the least sixes but we hit the most fours: GT's Kirsten
342.article_body: GT batting coach Gary Kirsten said they realised they were the team who were going to hit the least sixes in IPL 2022, but they hit the most fours. "We faced the least dot balls in...[IPL 2022]," added Kirsten. "From a bowling perspective, we knew we wanted to be the...best in the powerplay and best at the death," stated Kirsten.

343.title: Former Colombian drug lord 'Chess Player' dies in US prison
343.article_body: Gilberto Orejuela, the former leader of Colombia's drug trafficking Cali Cartel, died of lymphoma in a US prison while serving a 30-year drug trafficking sentence, his family said on Wednesday. Nicknamed 'The Chess Player', Orejuela was considered to be one of the world's biggest drug lords after Pablo Escobar's death in 1993. He was extradited to the US in 2004.

344.title: Bank manager from Rajasthan shot dead in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam
344.article_body: A bank manager named Vijay Kumar from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam, South Kashmir. Police said that Kumar was the bank manager at Ellaquai Dehati Bank in Kulgam district and was a resident of Hanumangarh in Rajasthan. This comes just two days after a teacher named Rajni Bala was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam.

345.title: Hardik's captaincy a real lesson for many other captains: Gary Kirsten
345.article_body: GT mentor Gary Kirsten has said Hardik Pandya's captaincy in IPL 2022 was a "real lesson" for many other captains. "His captaincy was beautiful to watch...He never chased the spotlight and the profile that comes with captaincy," added Kirsten. "He remained Hardik the person, easy to talk to, always asking questions about how he can improve," he further said.

346.title: We will only have 1 Cristiano: Carlos on picking Ronaldo over Messi
346.article_body: Talking about picking Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his ultimate Champions League XI, ex-Real Madrid defender Roberto Carlos said, "Cristiano represents exactly what the Champions League is and modern football." "We will only have one Cristiano," added Carlos. Cristiano has won the Champions League five times so far. Messi won all four of his Champions League titles with Barcelona.

347.title: Kolkata killed KK: Om Puri's ex-wife Nandita Puri
347.article_body: Late actor Om Puri's former wife Nandita Puri on Wednesday said that Kolkata administration killed singer KK. She wrote, "With a crowd of 7k for a 2.5k capacity, failed air conditioning; the singer perspiring profusely complained 4 times to no avail." This comes after reports claimed that KK was seen uncomfortable during his live performance due to heat and crowd.

348.title: 24-year-old woman in Gujarat to marry herself, says 'Want to portray that women matter'
348.article_body: A 24-year-old woman named Kshama Bindu will get married to herself on June 11 in Gujarat's Vadodara.
